usta: <entryFree id="n49942" type="main" key="usta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">usta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>uro</etym>, <sense id="n49942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of red color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burnt cinnabar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 20, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ustica: <entryFree id="n49943" type="main" key="Usti_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ustīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n49943.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small hill in the Sabine country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Horace's villa</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Val d'Ustica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49943.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small island north of Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
usticius: <entryFree id="n49944" type="main" key="usti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ustīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uro</etym>, of a color <sense id="n49944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">produced by burning</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">brown</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ustilago: <entryFree id="n49945" type="main" key="usti^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ustĭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> carduus silvaticus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ustio: <entryFree id="n49946" type="main" key="usti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ustĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>uro</etym>, <sense id="n49946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">searing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cauterizing</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si costa cariosa est, inutilis ustio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam ustione sanantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 44, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementior sinapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 239</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ustor: <entryFree id="n49947" type="main" key="ustor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ustor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burner</hi> of dead bodies, <hi rend="ital">a corpse-burner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 59, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 738</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ustricula: <entryFree id="n49948" type="main" key="ustri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ustrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ustor</etym>, <sense id="n49948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female hair-curler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl> dub. <pb n="1938" /> <cb n="USUR" /></sense></entryFree>
ustrina: <entryFree id="n49949" type="main" key="ustri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ustrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>uro</etym>. * <sense id="n49949.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49949.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place for burning corpses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4517</bibl>; cf. Fest. s. v. bustum, p. 32.—Called also ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">ustrī-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 656, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">755, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1044, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ustulo: <entryFree id="n49950" type="main" key="ustu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ustŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n49950.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49950.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to burn a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scorch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singe</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. amburo): palos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleas oleagineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput ferventi ferro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to crisp the hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 46</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n49950.2" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to burn up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> by fire: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta lignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 8</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n49950.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pinch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nip</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">blast</hi> with cold: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas (arboris) frigoris aurā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ustura: <entryFree id="n49951" type="main" key="ustu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ustūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the burning</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fervoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:14:93" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 14, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 3:8:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis ad usturam infertur injustis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ustus: <entryFree id="n49952" type="main" key="ustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of uro.</entryFree>
usualis: <entryFree id="n49953" type="main" key="u_su^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. usus</etym>. <sense id="n49953.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That is for use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit for use</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n49953.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7</bibl>, n. 150.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsŭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the usual manner</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
usuarius: <entryFree id="n49954" type="main" key="u_su^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usuary</hi>, viz., </sense><sense id="n49954.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is used</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made use of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>whom one has the use of</tr>, <tr>but does not own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49954.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsŭā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who uses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">has the use of</hi> a thing, but no right of property in it: <cit><quote lang="la">usus aquae personalis est: et ideo ad heredem usuarii transmitti non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem et in usuario dicenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 1, 13, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
usucapio: <entryFree id="n49955" type="main" key="u_su_ca^pi^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsū-căpĭo</orth> (in recent edd. usually separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsū căpĭo</orth>), <itype>cēpi, captum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>; jurid. t. t., <sense id="n49955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to acquire ownership</hi> of a thing <hi rend="ital">by long use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acquire by prescription</hi> or <hi rend="ital">usucaption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam hereditas usu capta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio jam biennium transisse, omniaque me usucepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam penes se culpam esse, quod Hannibal jam velut usu cepisset Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsiciva, ut usu capta, concessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius pro donato non capiet usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:7:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius est, ut usu eas capere non possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:29" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 41, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49956" type="main" key="u_su_ca^pi^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsū-căpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; jurid. t. t., <sense id="n49956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the acquisition of ownership by long use</hi> or <hi rend="ital">possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usucaption</hi>: usucapio est dominii adeptio per continuationem possessionis anni vel biennii; rerum mobilium anni, immobilium biennii, Ulp. Fragm. tit. 19; cf. Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 41</bibl> sqq.; 2, 61; 2, 68; 2, 204; 4, 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 26, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41</bibl>, tit. 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 28</bibl> sq.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">usus capio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes separated: <cit><quote lang="la">usu quoque capio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
usucaptus: <entryFree id="n49957" type="main" key="u_su_captus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsūcaptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of usucapio.</entryFree>
usufacio: <entryFree id="n49958" type="main" key="u_su_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsū-făcĭo</orth>, v. 2. usus, I. B. 2. b. <foreign lang="greek">b.</foreign></entryFree>
usufructuarius: <entryFree id="n49959" type="main" key="u_su_fructu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsūfructŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>usufructus; v. 2. usus, I. B. 2. a.</etym>, <sense id="n49959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has the use and profit but not the property of a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a usufructuary</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:7 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
usura: <entryFree id="n49960" type="main" key="u_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>utor</etym>, <sense id="n49960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a using</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">enjoyment</hi> of a thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n49960.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: solis usura, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 231, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva exigui temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longi temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 93</bibl></cit>: corporis, Plaut Am. prol. 108; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 144</bibl> gloriae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:34:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 34, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49960.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in mercantile lang., <hi rend="ital">a use of money lent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo pecuniam pro usurā auferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:72:section=168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 72, § 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49960.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">interest</hi> paid for the use of money, <hi rend="ital">usury</hi> (reckoned by the month among the Romans; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fenus): lex, ut sexenni die sine usuris creditae pecuniae solvantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui usuram pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usuras dare, accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usuram perscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 3</bibl></cit> minuere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:62:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 62, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vorax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certare cum usuris fructibus praediorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to spend the whole income of their estates in paying interest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aes alienum patiebatur multiplicandis usuris crescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usura plurium annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: debitor usuram pariter sortemque<cb n="USUR" />  negabit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:43:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 43, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam sub usuris mutuam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 6, 7, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49960.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">interest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra, quae numquam recusat imperium, nec umquam sine usurā reddit quod accepit, sed alias minore, plerumque majore cum fenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diutius servata usuram adiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:69:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 69, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā quāque occasione (litteras) mitte, appositis quidem usuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has usuras voluptatium pendimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
usurarius: <entryFree id="n49961" type="main" key="u_su_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>usura</etym>. <sense id="n49961.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That serves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is fit for use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of which one has the use</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoyment</hi>, = usuarius: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49961.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to interest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">usury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that pays interest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans><tr>at interest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:37" default="NO">3, 5, 37</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
usureceptio: <entryFree id="n49962" type="main" key="u_su_re^cepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsū-rĕceptĭo</orth> (also separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsū rĕceptĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; law t. t., <sense id="n49962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a recovery by usucaption of property once alienated</hi>: quae species usucapionis dicitur usureceptio, quia id quod aliquando habuimus recipimus per usucapionem, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 59</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
usurecipio: <entryFree id="n49963" type="main" key="u_su_re^ci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsū-rĕcĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>cēpi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n49963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> law t. t., <hi rend="ital">to recover by usucaption property once alienated</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
usurpabilis: <entryFree id="n49964" type="hapax" key="u_surpa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsurpābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>usurpo</etym>, <sense id="n49964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be used</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Mart. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
usurpatio: <entryFree id="n49965" type="main" key="u_surpa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsurpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking into use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a making use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">using</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi> of a thing (cf. usus). </sense><sense id="n49965.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">usurpatio et renovatio doctrinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:250" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 71, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:64:section=166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 64, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superba nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 7, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris insoliti,</quote> <trans><tr>the undertaking of a journey so uncommon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae mentis,</quote> <trans><tr>enjoyment</tr>, <tr>possession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49965.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. lang., </sense><sense id="n49965.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A seizing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">using unlawfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usurpation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sanctitatem baptismatis illicitā usurpatione geminaverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vim et usurpationem vindicare ac tenere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49965.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A using by another party</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whereby a prescription</hi> or <hi rend="ital">usucaption is interrupted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurpatio est usucapionis interruptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
usurpative: <entryFree id="n49966" type="main" key="u_surpa_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsurpātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. usurpativus <sense id="n49966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
usurpativus: <entryFree id="n49967" type="main" key="u_surpa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsurpātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>usurpo, II. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n49967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wrongly used</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unusual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usurpative</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">species verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 389</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Diff. Verb. p. 2764</bibl> ib. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsurpātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an unusual manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improperly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurpative ait hordea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 210</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 289</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
usurpator: <entryFree id="n49968" type="main" key="u_surpa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsurpātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who uses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">takes possession unlawfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a usurper</hi> of a thing (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">indebitae potestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: tanti nominis, Symm. Or. ap. Val. 1, 22.—</sense><sense id="n49968.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one who accomplishes</hi>: ardui operis, Jul. Sev. Syn. praef. 1.</sense></entryFree>
usurpatorius: <entryFree id="n49969" type="main" key="u_surpa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsurpātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>usurpator</etym>, <sense id="n49969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">usurping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usurpatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 47, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsurpātōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">presumptuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretentiously</hi>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 3, 15, n. 64; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 5, § 23 al.</sense></entryFree>
usurpatrix: <entryFree id="n49970" type="main" key="u_surpa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsurpātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n49970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that assumes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">takes to herself without right</hi> (late Lat.): innocentiae (arrogantia), Salv. Gub. Dei, 3, 12.</sense></entryFree>
usurpo: <entryFree id="n49971" type="main" key="usurpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">usurpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perh. contr. from usu rapio, to seize to one's own use</etym>, <sense id="n49971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take into use; to make use of; to use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy</hi> (class.; cf. utor). </sense><sense id="n49971.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter novam rem verbum usurpabo vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen tantum virtutis usurpas: quid ipsa valeat, ignoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at quam crebro usurpat Et consul, et Antonius!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare est hoc usurpatum a doctissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinae condicionis homines vetuit usurpare Romana nomina, duntaxat gentilicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: o barathrum! ubi nunc es? ut ego te usurpem lubens! <hi rend="ital">I would occupy thee</hi> (<hi rend="ital">cast myself into thee</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus poenae saepe in improbos cives hac in re publicā esse usurpatum recordatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusio, quā credo usuros veteres illos fuisse, si jam nota atque usurpata res esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 51, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id nunc jure imperii nostri quotannis usurpatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:20:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 20, § 51</bibl></cit>; consolationes, <cb n="USUS" /> a sapientissimis viris usurpatae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucas tribus ad usurpandam libertatem vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium, quod semper usurpavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est, qui C. Fabricii, M'. Curii non um caritate aliquā benevolentiae memoriam usurpet?</quote> <trans><tr>who does not cherish the memory of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec patrum nec avorum memoriā quemquam id jus usurpasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solita munia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo comitatem et temperantiam, saepius violentiam ac libidines usurpans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium post labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec puduit has vestis usurpare etiam viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi quisque dominorum usurpat servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6:6:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 6, 6, § 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed de hoc post erit usurpandum, cum de poëtis dicemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: usurpatum est, <hi rend="ital">it is usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">customary;</hi> with a foll. <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 1, § 6</bibl>: quod in quibusdam provinciis usurpatur, Co. 2, 2, 22.— </sense><sense id="n49971.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49971.3" n="A" level="2"> Aliquid oculis, auribus, etc., <hi rend="ital">to take possession</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cognizance of</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, etc., through the senses (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec calidos aestus tuimur, nec frigora quimus Usurpare oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advenio ex Seleuciā, Macedoniā atque Arabiā, Quas ego neque oculis neque pedibus umquam usurpavi meis,</quote> <trans><tr>I have never seen nor set foot in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:975" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 975</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde meae usurpant aures sonitum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49971.4" n="B" level="2"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">to get possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">amissam possessionem ex jure civili surculo defringendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec interest is qui usurpaverit (possessionem) dominus sit, necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatores, qui de fundis fiscalibus mercari consuerunt, nullam immunitatem solvendi publici vectigalis usurpare possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:9:section=8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39, 4, 9, § 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Abscl.</hi>: Mucium dicere solitum, lege non isse usurpatum mulierem, quae, cum Kal. Jan. apud virum matrimonii causā esse coepisset, a. d. IIII. Kal. Jan. sequentis usurpatum isset; <cit><quote lang="la">non enim posse impleri trinoctium, quod abesse a viro usurpandi causa ex XII. tabulis deberet, because, unless absent from him at least three full days of the year, she became subject to him as his wife by prescription,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2, 12 sq.</bibl></cit> Weiss (Herz. legi: non esse usurpatam mulierem); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 31</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:6:8 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 6, 8 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49971.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To assume</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appropriate unlawfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to usurp</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem Romanam usurpantes securi percussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominium totius loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illicitum collegium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:22:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus jus tyranni quaque usurparunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienam possessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionem Armeniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49971.6" n="C" level="2"> To make use of or be acquainted with under any name, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to name</hi> or <hi rend="ital">call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speak of</hi> habitually, <hi rend="ital">adopt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi> in words or speech (cf. nuncupo): <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem atque Junonem, reliquos, quos fratres inter se agnatosque usurpari atque appellari videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soleo saepe ante oculos ponere idque libenter crebris usurpare sermonibus, omnis posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecum verbum usurpavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonet saepe usurpatae Dionysi tyranni vocis, quā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe eum usurpasse vocem, multo miserius seni exilium esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 40, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulata instituenda sunt: hoc enim nomine usurpant agricolae ramos truncosque prominentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Laelius, is, qui Sapiens usurpatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc decere ... quod semper usurpamus in omnibus dictis et factis ..cum hoc, inquam, decere dicimus,</quote> <trans><tr>speak of</tr>, <tr>insist on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
usus: <entryFree id="n49972" type="main" key="u_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of utor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49973" type="main" key="u_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>utor</etym>, <sense id="n49973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the use</hi> or <hi rend="ital">using</hi> of any thing, in the widest sense (cf.: consuetudo, mos). </sense><sense id="n49973.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49973.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n49973.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi> of any thing; with <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus in usu sui tota posita est: usus autem ejus est maximus civitatis gubernatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, ad virtutis usum idonea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quaeque ipsi doceant in usu habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec rhus Latinum nomen habet, cum in usum pluribus modis veniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 54, § 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Wear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wearing out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ferreus adsiduo consumitur anulus usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silices tenuantur ab usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoyment</hi>,<pb n="1939" /> <cb n="USUS" />  <hi rend="ital">fruition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et usu rerum necessarium et dignitate spoliatum iri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantumque nobis in nostrum privatum usum, quantum ipsi superesse posset, remitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave sis ne tu te usu perduis (i. e. ex usu tui),</quote> <trans><tr>lose control of yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 225</bibl></cit> Ussing ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n49973.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum usu cottidiano et exercitatione efficiunt, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod adsiduus usus uni rei deditus et ingenium et artem saepe vincit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rerum magnarum tractatio atque usus cum illarum artium studiis et cognitione conjungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam doctrinam, quam suo quisque studio adsecutus esset, adjungeretur usus frequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docuit nos longa vita ususque rerum maximarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 50, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usu quidem in re publicā rerum maximarum facile omnis viceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 23, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discipline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skill</hi> acquired by practice (cf. experientia): <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> O Geta, provinciam Cepisti duram. <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Mi usus venit, hoc scio, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I have found it so by experience</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 23</bibl> (al. usu venit; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II. C. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir tali prudentiā, etiam usu atque exercitatione praeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res posita in usu militari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum in re publicā magnum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: magnum in re militari usum habere, Caes B G. 1, 39; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non recusare se, quin nullius usus imperator existimaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo usu rei militaris percepto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usu nauticarum rerum ceteros antecedunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne usu manuque reliquorum opinionem fallerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Marius aut belli usum aut studia volgi amissurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 89:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 89, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dantur duo usu sapientiāque praestantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seris venit usus ab annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum foeda clades, Romanisque usu incognita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:23" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>. —Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">adiciam quod me docuit usus, magister egregius,</quote> <trans><tr>experience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum et esse et haberi optimum dicendi magistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.8" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum loquendi populo concessi: scientiam mihi reservavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi omnis ratio in medio posita communi quodam in usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quem usum belli haberent, aut quibus institutis uterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitulos) ad studium atque usum formabis agrestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est omnino Capitoni in usu claros viros colere,</quote> <trans><tr>it is his custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum auctoritate suā ad usum frugalitatis revocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his Galli usum vitae cultioris didicerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 43, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at horum recitatio usu jam recepta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadent vocabula, si volet usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49973.10" n="1" level="3"> In jurid. lang. </sense><sense id="n49973.11" n="a" level="4"> Usus et fructus, usus fructusque, and more frequently in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsusfructus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the use and enjoyment of property belonging to another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usufruct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus enim ejus fundi et fructus testamento viri fuerat Caesenniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi horum usus fructusque contingat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 73, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem nobis eripit casus, usum fructumque apud nos relinquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 98:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 98, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usumfructum omnium bonorum suorum Caesenniae legat, ut frueretur una cum filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ususfructus est jus alienis rebus utendi fruendi, salvā rerum substantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; v. the entire title, usufructu: dominus proprietatis alii usumfructum in jure cedere potest, Gai inst. 2, 30 sqq.; 2, 86; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 15, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A use that creates ownership</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquisition by prescription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usucaption.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49973.13" n="(a)" level="5"> In the connection usus et auctoritas, or without the copula, usus auctoritas; v. auctoritas; and cf. Rein, Röm. Privatr. p. 144 sq.—</sense><sense id="n49973.14" n="(b)" level="5"> In the phrase usu capere, <hi rend="ital">to acquire by prescription</hi> (often as one word; v. 1. usucapio); hence, com.: <hi rend="ital">Mer.</hi> Quojus nunc es? <hi rend="ital">Sos.</hi> Tuos: <cit><quote lang="la">nam pugnis usu fecisti tuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 218</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Intercourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">familiarity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">association</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">society</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo, conversatio): domesticus usus et consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocum mihi est magnus usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 25, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctus magno usu familiaritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tanto usu nostro tantāque amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nosmet ipsos vetus usus intercedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: ut insinuaret<cb n="USUS" />  se in quam maxime familiarem usum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 21, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recens praestat nec longo cognitus usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio nullo commercio colens mutuos usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem in usu habes nisi tibi dilectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:88" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 88</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49973.16" n="b" level="4"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 357</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.17" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reality</hi> (opp. species): <cit><quote lang="la">ut (liberi) in usum boni sint et in speciem populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam alteram (partem Numidiae) specie quam usu potiorem Adherbal possedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non in usum sic ad speciem imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:13:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n49973.18" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49973.19" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis fructus, exiguus usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arborum) consectio magnos usus affert ad navigia facienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter lini inopiam atque ejus usus inscientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves factae subito ex umidā materiā non eundem usum celeritatis habebant,</quote> <trans><tr>capacity</tr>, <tr>fitness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natis in usum laetitiae scyphis Pugnare,</quote> <trans><tr>service</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum cogere humanos in usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater, si das hujus mihi nominis usum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis, quo valeat numus? quem praebeat usum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidve ad amicitias, usus rectumne trahat nos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quisquam omnium libidini simul et usui paruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures quam quot satis in usum erant ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos quos domum quis ducet suo usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:203" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicuta quoque venenum est ... ad multa tamen usus non omittendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 151</bibl></cit>.—In partic., usui or ex usu esse, <hi rend="ital">to be of use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">profitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse usui civitati, ea, quae sunt usui ad armandas naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Satrius) fuit et mihi et Quinto fratri magno usui in nostris petitionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno usui rei publicae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 11, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono usui esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritos legum ad condenda nova jura usui fore credebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declararent, utrum proelium ex usu esset necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex usu esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 110, § 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnia haec magis opportunus nec magis ex usu tuo Nemo'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9</bibl></cit> (8), 47. —</sense><sense id="n49973.20" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necessity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te instruere domum tuam voluerunt in provinciā, sed illum usum provinciae supplere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae belli usus poscunt, suppeditare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 43, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc euntium, quā quemque suorum usuum causae ferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 25, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.21" n="2" level="3"> Usus est, or usus venit, <hi rend="ital">there is need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is necessary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">becomes requisite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49973.22" n="a" level="4"> Usus est (most freq. ante-class., esp. after the analogy of opus est with the <case>abl.</case>). </sense><sense id="n49973.23" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">egomet mihi fero, quod usu'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque usus siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; and, with <hi rend="ital">ellipsis</hi> of <hi rend="ital">subst. verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico ut usus fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando usus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 92</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Mihi sic est usus: tibi ut opus facto'st, face. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> An cuiquam est usus homini, se ut cruciet? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Mihi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:28 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 28 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut equites Pompeianorum impetum, cum adesset usus, sustinere non possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.24" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti jam usu'st filio argenti minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier quae se suamque aetatem spernit, speculo ei usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curatore usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam rem usus est tuā mihi operā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacere nequeo misera, quod tacito usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argento invento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 56 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis, quibus usus non est, omnis praecidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (navibus) consuli usus non esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc viribus usus, Nunc manibus rapidis, omni nunc arte magistrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam rem usu'st homine astuto, docto, scito et callido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 151</bibl></cit>.—Pleonast.: <cit><quote lang="la">non usus facto'st mihi nunc hunc intro sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.25" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ad me ut veniat usu'st Acroteleutium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 28</bibl> supra.— </sense><sense id="n49973.26" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii offerunt se, si quo usus operae sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.27" n="b" level="4"> Usus venit (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis usus venerit, Meminisse ego hanc rem vos volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: quom ad praetorem usus veniet, id. Poen. <cb n="UT" /> 3, 4, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si usus vene rit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non usus veniet, spero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si usus veniat, suum quisque locum teneat,</quote> <trans><tr>if occasion should arise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.28" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi usus veniat contra consertā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.29" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fit occasion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi> to be used. </sense><sense id="n49973.30" n="1" level="3"> Usus est or adest, <hi rend="ital">an occasion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opportunity offers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ceteris studiis alio loco dicemus, si usus fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49973.31" n="2" level="3"> Esp.: usu venit, <hi rend="ital">it happens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occurs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befalls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quid homini potest turpius, quid viro miserius aut acerbius usu venire?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:39:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 39, § 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id culpa senectutis accideret, eadem mihi usu venirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem solet in demonstratione usu venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 54, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod item in poëmatis, in picturis usu venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc illud eis usu venire solet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praesertim mihi usu venturum non arbitrarer, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: et, id quod usu venerat, Eumolpidas demigravit, <hi rend="ital">actually occurred</hi> (however strange), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod numquam antea usu venerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemeditatus, quid sibi esset usu venturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar biduum in iis locis moratus, quod haec de Vercingetorige usu ventura opinione perceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usu venire ut abhorreant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—Separated or in a reversed order: <cit><quote lang="la">non venit idem usu mihi quod tu tibi scribis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cuipiam Thraco venisse usu fabula est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, quod usu memoria patrum venit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ususfructus: <entryFree id="n49974" type="main" key="u_susfructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūsusfructus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. usus, I. B. 2. a.</entryFree>
ut: <entryFree id="n49975" type="main" key="ut"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ut</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtī</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtei</orth>, C. I. L. 1, 196, 4 sq.; 1, 198, 8 et saep.), <pos>adv.</pos> and <sense id="n49975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [for quoti or cuti, from pronom. stem ka-, Lat. quo-, whence qui, etc., and locat. ending -ti of stem to-, whence tum, etc.]. </sense><sense id="n49975.1" n="I" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">adv. of manner.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.2" n="A" level="2"> Interrog. = quomodo, <hi rend="ital">how</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in what way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.3" n="1" level="3"> In independent questions (colloq.; rare in class. prose; not in Cic.): <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Quid? ut videtur mulier? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Non, edepol, mala. <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Ut morata'st? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Nullam vidi melius meā sententiā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:56 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 56 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salve! ut valuisti? quid parentes mei? Valent?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vales?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 19, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sese in Samnio res habent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut valet? ut meminit nostri?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.4" n="2" level="3"> In exclamatory sentences (in all periods of the language): ut omnia in me conglomerat mala! Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 14</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 408 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut corripuit se repente atque abiit! Hei misero mihi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dissimulat malus!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut volupe est homini si cluet victoria!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: ut multa verba feci; <cit><quote lang="la">ut lenta materies fuit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut scelestus nunc iste te ludos facit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut saepe summa ingenia in occulto latent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 33</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut falsus animi est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heia! ut elegans est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna ut numquam perpetua est bona!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gnaeus autem noster ... ut totus jacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ut sustinuit! ut contempsit, ac pro nihilo putavit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 24, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tum dicit testimonium ex nostris hominibus, ut se ipse sustentat! ut omnia verba moderatur, ut timet ne quid cupide ... dicat!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum facis, ut ego tuum amorem et dolorem desidero!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta studia decertantium sunt! ut illi efferuntur laetitiā cum vicerint! ut pudet victos! ut se accusari nolunt! etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vidi, ut perii! ut me malus abstulit error!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut melius quidquid erit pati!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu Semper eris derisor!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o superbia magnae fortunae! ut a te nihil accipere juvat! ut omne beneficium in injuriam convertis! ut te omnia nimia delectant! ut to omnia dedecent!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me in supremis consolatus est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. 11.—</sense><sense id="n49975.5" n="3" level="3"> In dependent questions. </sense><sense id="n49975.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): divi hoc audite parumper ut pro Romano populo ... animam de corpore mitto, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 150, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 215 Vahl.): edoce eum uti res se habet, Plaut. <pb n="1940" /> <cb n="UT" /> Trin. 3, 3, 21: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sis vide ut avariter merum in se ingurgitat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vide ut dormiunt pessuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vide os ut sibi distorsit carnufex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ut otiosus it, si dis placet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vide, Ut in ipso articulo oppressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viden ut faces Splendidas quatiunt comas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viden ut perniciter exiluere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 62, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspicite, innuptae secum ut meditata requirunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 62, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice, venturo laetantur ut omnia saeclo! (= omnia laetantia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 52</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides, croceos ut Tmolus odores, India mittit ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 779</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49975.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nescis ut res sit, Phoenicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido Mihi illud videri mirum, ut una illaec capra Uxoris dotem simiae ambadederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ego vos novisse credo jam ut sit meus pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narratque ut virgo ab se integra etiam tum siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tute scis quam intimum Habeam te, et mea consilia ut tibi credam omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis ut omnes despiciat, ut hominem prae se neminem putet, ut se solum beatum se solum potentem putet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtisne ut Nestor de virtutibus suis praedicet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo te audisse ut me circumsteterint, ut aperte jugula sua pro meo capite P. Clodio ostentarint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videte ut hoc iste correxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docebat ut omni tempore totius Galliae principatum Aedui tenuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
