G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniat in mentem, ut trepidos quondam majores vestros ... defenderimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice quo submittat humus formosa colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infinitum est enumerare ut Cottae detraxerit auctoritatem, ut pro Ligario se opposuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides ut altā stet nive candidum Soracte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides, ut ... latus et malus Antennaeque gemant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">audis ... positas ut glaciet nives Puro numine Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 315</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:26" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (3, 32), 57: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum est ut animus agitatione motuque corporis excitetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.8" n="B" level="2"> Relative adverb of manner = eo modo quo, <hi rend="ital">as.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.9" n="1" level="3"> Without demonstr. as correlatives: ut aiunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=101" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 101</bibl> Müll. (fr inc. l. 10 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego emero matri tuae Ancillam ... formā malā, ut matrem addecet familias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus sum ut videtis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum postremo impetravi ut volui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ero ut me voles esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciam ut tu voles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 90</bibl></cit>: ut vales? <hi rend="ital">Tox.</hi> Ut queo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut potero feram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciam ut mones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronem et ut rogas amo, et ut meretur et ut debeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates quae possunt esse in eo qui, ut ipse accusator objecit, ruri semper habitarit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex propinquis ejus audio, non tu in isto artificio callidior es, quam hic in suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo demens, ut isti putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulate munus hoc, ut opinio mea fert, effecero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut clim solebat, sed ut nunc fit, mimum introduxisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Labienus, ut erat ei praeceptum, ne proelium committeret nisi, etc., monte occupato nostros exspectabat, proelioque abstinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta ut gesta erant exposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Postumius) fugerat in legatione, ut fama ferebat, populi judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 46, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed, ut plerumque fit, major pars meliorem vicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec temere, et ut libet conlocatur argentum, sed perite servitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus, ut placet Chrysippo, perpetuus mercenarius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:22:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—Esp. parenthet., to denote that the facts accord with an assumption or supposition made in the principal sentence (= sicut): <cit><quote lang="la">si virtus digna est gloriatione, ut est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:18:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum etiamsi amplecterer virtutem, ut facio, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis fuerit acutus, ut fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incumbite in causam, Quirites, ut facitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu modo istam imbecillitatem valetudinis sustenta, ut facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis enim erat, probatum illum esse populo Romano, ut est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.10" n="2" level="3"> With the correlative <hi rend="ital">ita</hi> or <cb n="UT" /> <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: VTI LEGASSIT SVPER PECVNIA TVTELAVE SVAE REI, ITA IVS ESTO, Leg. XII. Tab. 5, fr. 3: alii, ut esse in suam rem ducunt, ita sint; <cit><quote lang="la">ego ita ero ut me esse oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:24 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 24 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic sum ut vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes posthabui mihi res, ita uti par fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut viro forti ac sapienti dignum fuit, ita calumniam ejus obtrivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—In partic. with a superlative belonging to the principal sentence, attracted to the relative clause: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ut brevissime dici potuerunt, ita a me dicta sunt (= ita breviter dicta sunt ut dici potuerunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 174</bibl></cit>.—So ut qui, with <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te enim semper sic colam et tuebor ut quem diligentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; without <hi rend="ital">sic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ita</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas ut honorificentissimis verbis consequi potero, complectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed exigenda est ut optime possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 38</bibl></cit>.—And with <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditus autem sic ut nemo Thebanus magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad unguem Factus homo, non ut magis alter, amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cocto Chium sic convenit, ut non Hoc magis ullum aliud,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.11" n="3" level="3"> Doubled ut ut, as indefinite relative, = utcumque, <hi rend="ital">in whatever manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">howsoever</hi> (mostly ante-class.; only with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">gaudeo, ut ut erga me est merita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age jam, utut est, etsi'st dedecori, patiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utut est, mihi quidem profecto cum istis dictis mortuo'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utut res sese habet, pergam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potis est pietati opsisti huic, ututi res sunt ceterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ut ut haec sunt, tamen hoc faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ut est res, casus consilium nostri itineris judicabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 25</bibl></cit> B. and K. (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Orell. ad loc.): sed ut ut est, indulge valetudini tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 1</bibl></cit> dub. (al. ut est).— </sense><sense id="n49975.12" n="4" level="3"> Causal, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, = prout, pro eo ut. </sense><sense id="n49975.13" n="a" level="4"> Introducing a general statement, in correspondence with the particular assertion of the principal clause, ut = <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considering ... that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in accordance with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque, ut nunc sunt maledicentes homines, uxori meae mihique objectent, lenociniam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aetas mea est, atque ut huic usus facto est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud scio hercle ut homo'st, an mutet animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim, ut nunc sunt mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ille, ut semper fuit apertissimus, non se purgavit, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta alia colligit Chrysippus, ut est in omni historiā curiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifice et ornate, ut erat in primis inter suos copiosus, convivium comparat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kal. Sextilibus, ut tunc principium anni agebatur, consulatum ineunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni, ut fere semper reguntur a multitudine magis quam regunt, dedere plebi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 71, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transire pontem non potuerunt, ut extrema resoluta erant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 47, 3</bibl></cit>.—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortales multi, ut ad ludos, convenerant (ut fit, si ludi sunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicharmi, acuti nec insulsi hominis, ut Siculi,</quote> <trans><tr>as was natural</tr>, <tr>he being a Sicilian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Diogenes, liberius, ut Cynicus ... inquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 33, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum haec, ut in secundis rebus, segniter otioseque gesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.14" n="b" level="4"> Reflecting the assertion to particular circumstances, etc., ut = <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Geta ut captus est servorum, non malus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut est captus hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl>: Themistocles ut apud nos perantiquus, ut apud Athenienses non ita sane vetus, <hi rend="ital">in regard to us</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 10, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caelius Antipater, scriptor, ut temporibus illis, luculentus,</quote> <trans><tr>for those times</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnihil, ut in tantis malis est profectum,</quote> <trans><tr>considering the unfortunate state of affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orationis genus) ut in oratore exile,</quote> <trans><tr>for an orator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:18:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 18, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae (erant in Fabio) ut in homine Romano, litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultissimus vir, ut in illā quisquam esse aetate poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentem jam ut tum res erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollonides orationem salutarem, ut in tali tempore, habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sp. Maelius, ut illis temporibus praedives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: insigni, ut illorum temporum habitus erat, triumpho, <cb n="UT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 46, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ardeam Rutuli habebant, gens ut in eā regione atque in eā aetate divitiis praepollens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 57, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir, ut inter Aetolos, facundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 33, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Meneclidas, satis exercitatus in dicendo, ut Thebanus scilicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad magnam deinde, ut in eā regione, urbem pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum, ut inter Germanos, rationis ac sollertiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49975.15" n="c" level="4"> Ut before relatives, with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it is natural for persons who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like one who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since they</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">seeing that they</hi>, etc. (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">non demutabo ut quod certo sciam,</quote> <trans><tr>seeing that I know it for certain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā luce sic ab castris proficiscuntur ut quibus esset persuasum non ab hoste, sed ab homine amicissimo consilium datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile persuadent (Lucumoni) ut cupido honorum, et cui Tarquinii materna tantum patria esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde consul, ut qui jam ad hostes perventum cerneret, explorato, etc., procedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus, ut cui de summā rerum adesset certamen, adhortandos milites ratus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinius ad jus regni nihil praeter vim habebat, ut qui neque populi jussu, neque auctoribus patribus regnaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 49, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 23, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aequorum exercitus, ut qui permultos annos imbelles egissent, sine ducibus certis, sine imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 45, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur pro se quisque inermes, ut quibus nihil hostile suspectum esset, in agmen Romanum ruebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 29, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia nova offendit, ut qui solus didicerit quod inter multos faciendum est,</quote> <trans><tr>as is natural in one who</tr>, <tr>since he</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni autem speciali inest generalis, ut quae sit prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignara hujusce doctrinae loquacitas erret necesse est, ut quae vel multos vel falsos duces habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:28" default="NO">5, 14, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO">11, 3, 53</bibl>.—Rarely with participle: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Volsci et Aequi ... ad urbem ut ex parte captam venirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens ferox cum procul visis Romanorum signis, ut extemplo proelium initura, explicuisset aciem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.16" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">perinde</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pro eo</hi>, with reference to several alternatives or degrees to be determined by circumstances, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the extent that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the measure that</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde ut opinio est de cujusque moribus, ita quid ab eo factum et non factum sit, existimari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exspectatione civitas erat, perinde ut evenisset res, ita communicatos honores habitura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: pro eo ut temporis difficultas aratorumque penuria tulit, Metell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:54:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 54, § 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.17" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of local relations, like Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i(/na</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">where</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in eopse astas lapide, ut praeco praedicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen uti adque ipso divortio (aquae sunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:8:18" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> 8, 18</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremos Indos, Litus ut longe resonante Eoā Tunditur undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 2</bibl></cit> sqq.; 17, 10; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 329</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 550</bibl> Munro ad loc.</sense><sense id="n49975.18" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Conj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.19" n="A" level="2"> Introducing comparative clauses of manner, = eodem modo quo, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.20" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n49975.21" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">sic</hi> as correlative: <cit><quote lang="la">haec res sic est ut narro tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si ut animis sic oculis videre possemus, nemo de divinā ratione dubitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pomponium Atticum sic amo ut alterum fratrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sic ageres ut de eis egisti qui jam mortui sunt ... ne tu in multos Autronios incurreres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:251" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 72, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic, Scipio, ut avus hic tuus, ut ego, justitiam cole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dicere alia aliis magis concessum est, sic etiam facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 11, 3, 150</bibl></cit> (for ut ... sic, in similes, v. sic, IV. 1. a.).—</sense><sense id="n49975.22" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ita</hi> as correlative: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sementem feceris, ita metes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:65:261" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 65, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem, ut ille solebat, ita nunc mea repetat oratio populi origines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1</bibl></cit>. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut injustus in pace rex ita dux belli pravus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haec in unum congeruntur, ita contra illa dispersa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.23" n="(g)" level="5"> With other correlatives: <cit><quote lang="la">in balteo tracta ex caseo ad eundem modum facito ut placentum sine melle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">encytum ad eundem modum facito uti globos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animi inaniter moveantur eodem modo rebus his quae nulla sint ut iis quae sint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationem exponimus, eisdem fere verbis, ut disputatumque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: scelerum caput, ut tute es item omnis censes esse' <pb n="1941" /> <cb n="UT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut filium bonum patri esse oportet, item ego sum patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecisti item ut praedones solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">item ut illo edicto de quo ante dixi ... edixit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>, § 117; <cit><quote lang="la">so with item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:60:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 60, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is reliquit filium Pariter moratum ut pater eius fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fallaciam astutiorem ullus fecit Poëta atque ut haec est fabrefacta a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—And after <hi rend="ital">aliter</hi> = <hi rend="ital">than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliter ut dixi accidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.24" n="(d)" level="5"> Without correlative: <cit><quote lang="la">rem omnem uti acta erat cognovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare perge ut instituisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud me, ut apud bonum judicem, argumenta plus quam testes valent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscent enim illas et interponunt vitae, ut ludum jocumque inter seria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitetur voluptas, et circa corpus ut umbra versetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 13:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in animum ejus oratio, ut sol in oculos, incurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.25" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49975.26" n="a" level="4"> Ut ... ita or ut ... sic; co-ordinate, introducing contrasted clauses. </sense><sense id="n49975.27" n="(a)" level="5"> = cum ... tum, <hi rend="ital">as ... so</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as on the one hand ... so on the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both and</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut errare potuisti, sic decipi te non potuisse, quis non videt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Poeni ad moenia urbis Romanae nullo prohibente se pervenisse in gloriā ponebant, ita pigebat irriti incepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolabellam ut Tarsenses ita Laodiceni ultra arcessierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert sortem suam quisque ut in ceteris rebus ita in amicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:28:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 28, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.28" n="(b)" level="5"> Concessive, = etsi ... tamen, <hi rend="ital">although ... yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul, ut fortasse vere, sic parum utiliter in praesens certamen, respondit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saguntini, ut a proeliis quietem habuerant per aliquot dies, ita non cessaverant ab opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quies certaminum erat, ita ab apparatu operum nihil cessatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia ut invitis, ita non adversantibus patriciis transacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 55, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agrum Nolanum exercitum traducit, ut non hostiliter statim, ita ... nihil praetermissurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 34, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti longe a luxuriā, ita famae propior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut multo infirmior, ita aliquatenus lucidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut est utilis saepe ... ita obstabit melioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod, ut optimum est, ita longe quidem, sed sequitur tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 62</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">certe</hi> in place of ita: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non demens, crudelis certe videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.29" n="b" level="4"> Ita ... ut; <cit><quote lang="la">in oaths or strong asseverations: ita me di amabunt ut ego hunc ausculto lubens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me di ament ut ego nunc non tam meāpte causā Laetor quam illius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me di amabunt, ut nunc Menedemi vicem Miseret me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita vivo ut maximos sumptus facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic me di amabunt ut me tuarum miseritum'st fortunarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.30" n="c" level="4"> In exemplifications. </sense><sense id="n49975.31" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">as for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam aut ipsa cognitio rei perquiritur, ut: virtus suam ne, etc., aut agendi consilium exquiritur, ut: sitne sapienti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:29:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 29, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt bestiae in quibus inest aliquid simile virtutis, ut in leonibus, ut in canibus, in equis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libero populo, ut Rhodi, ut Athenis, nemo est civium qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui rem publicam constituissent, ut Cretum Minos, Lacedaemoniorum Lycurgus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:52:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 52, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquid quod dominus praestare servo debeat, ut cibaria, ut vestiarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est etiam amarum quiddam ... et aere, ut illud Crassi Ego te consulem putem? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:12" default="NO">4, 3, 12</bibl>.—Where several instances are adduced, if each of them singly is made prominent, ut is repeated with each; <cit><quote lang="la">if they are taken in a group, ut occurs but once, e. g. quod erant, qui aut in re publicā, propter sapientiam florerent, ut Themistocles, ut Pericles, ut Theramenes, aut, qui .. sapientiae doctores essent, ut Gorgias, Thrasymachus, Isocrates, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.32" n="(b)" level="5"> Ut si, <hi rend="ital">if for instance; for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si accusetur is qui P. Sulpicium se fateatur occidisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si quis hoc velit ostendere, eum qui parentem necarit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si qui docilem faciat auditorem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si qui in foro cantet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="UT" /> 40, 145: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si quis ei quem urgeat fames venenum ponat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:49:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 49, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si obsessi de faciendā ad hostem deditione deliberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si des arma timidis et imbellibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:34" default="NO">5, 10, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:18" default="NO">2, 4, 18</bibl>; 9, 2, 79 et saep.—So with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum marem feminamque filios dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:22" default="NO">1, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:30" default="NO">3, 8, 30</bibl>; 9, 1, 3.—</sense><sense id="n49975.33" n="d" level="4"> Before an appositive noun, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the same as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui canem et felem ut deos colunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut militiae Africanum ut deum coleret Laelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam vitam ut legem praefert suis civibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit (ei) honorem ut proditori, non ut amico fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem, non ut prudentem tantum virum, sed ut vatem omnium quae tum evenirent admirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: (Dionysium) dimisi a me ut magistrum Ciceronum non lubenter; <cit><quote lang="la">ut hominem ingratum non invitus,</quote> <trans><tr>in his capacity of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ante captas Syracusas non desciverant ... ut socii fideles accepti, quos metus post captas Syracusas dediderat, ut victi a victore leges acceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui et ipsum, ut ambiguae fidei virum, suspectum jam pridem habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 45, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero ea quae nunc eveniunt cecinit ut vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ipsam (virtutem) ut deos, et professores ejus ut antistites colite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ut deum homines intuebuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ut crimen ingens expavescendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.34" n="e" level="4"> Ut si = quasi, velut si, tamquam si, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater coepit studiose ... educere ita uti si esset filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rufio tuus ita desiderabatur ut si esset unus e nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus negotium sic velim suscipias ut si esset res mea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita se gerant in istis Asiaticis itineribus ut si iter Appiā viā faceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui aliis nocent ut in alios liberales sint, in eādem sunt injustitiā ut si in suam rem aliena convertant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">similes sunt ut si qui gubernatorem in navigando nihil agere dicant,</quote> <trans><tr>like men who should say</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: similiter facere eos ... ut si nautae certarent, etc., <hi rend="ital">they act like sailors who</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.35" n="f" level="4"> Ut quisque ... ita (sic), with superlatives (= eo magis ... quo magis, with indefinite subjects): ut quisque est vir optimus, ita difficillime alios improbos suspicatur, <hi rend="ital">the better a man is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the more difficult it is for him to</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaeque res est turpissima, sic maxime et maturissime vindicanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque (morbus) est difficillimus, ita medicus nobilissimus quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 21, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque te maxime cognatione ... attingebat, ita maxime manus tua putabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ut quaeque forma perfectissima ita capacissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit>.—This construction is variously modified, </sense><sense id="n49975.36" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ita</hi> understood: <cit><quote lang="la">facillime ad res injustas impellitur ut quisque altissimo animo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 65</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49975.37" n="(b)" level="5"> With virtual superlatives: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque in fugā postremus ita in periculo princeps erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque optime institutus est, esse omnino nolit in vitā, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.38" n="(g)" level="5"> The superlatives omitted in either clause: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque aetate antecedit, ita sententiae principatum tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque aetate et honore antecedebat, ita sententiam dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:64:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 64, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro se quisque, ut in quoque erat auctoritatis plurimum, ad populum loquebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">68: ut quisque gradu proximus erat, ita ignominiae objectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque maxime laboraret locus, aut ipse occurrebat, aut aliquos mittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 38, 6</bibl></cit>.—And with <hi rend="ital">tum</hi> = ita: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prodesse tantum, sed etiam amari potest, tum ... ut quisque erit Ciceroni simillimus,</quote> <trans><tr>in proportion to his resemblance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.39" n="(d)" level="5"> With a comparative in one of the terms: <cit><quote lang="la">major autem (societas est) ut quisque proxime accederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Without superlative, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de captivis, ut quisque liber aut servus esset, suae fortunae a quoque sumptum supplicium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit> (for ut quisque ... ita, in temporal clauses, v. B. 3. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> infra).—</sense><sense id="n49975.40" n="B" level="2"> Introducing a temporal clause, the principal predicate being an immediate sequence; orig. <cb n="UT" /> = quo tempore. </sense><sense id="n49975.41" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">perf. indic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.42" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio ut illo advenimus ... continuo Amphitruo delegit viros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hinc te intro ire jussi, opportune hic fit mi obviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut abii abs te fit forte obviam Mihi Phormio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut modo argentum tibi dedimus apud forum, recta domum Sumus profecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ut peroravit, surrexit Clodius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eumque ut salutavit, amicissime apprehendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ut huc venit ... hominesque Romanos bellicis studiis ut vidit incensos, existimavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vero aquam ingressi sunt ... tum utique egressis rigere omnibus corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haec dicta in senatu sunt, dilectus edicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 34, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 44, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.43" n="b" level="4"> In oblique discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariovistum, ut semel Gallorum copias vicerit, superbe et crudeliter imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.44" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">primum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">when first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as ever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ego, ut primum fletu represso loqui posse coepi, Quaeso inquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculi, ut primum videre volgari morbos, in suas quisque urbes dilapsi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 26, 13</bibl></cit>: ut primum lingua coepit esse in quaestu, curam morum qui diserti habebantur reliquerunt, Quint. prooem. 13.— </sense><sense id="n49975.45" n="d" level="4"> Rarely of coincidence in time: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ut dudum adcurrimus ad Alcesimarchum ... tum mi puto prae timore hic excidisse Cistellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.46" n="e" level="4"> Ut = ex quo tempore. <hi rend="ital">since</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Brundusio profectus es, nullae mihi abs te sunt redditae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.47" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">imperf. indic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.48" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: Fabii oratio fuit qualis biennio ante; <cit><quote lang="la">deinde, ut vincebatur consensu, versa ad P. Decium collegam poscendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ut nullā vi perculsos sustinere poterat, Quid ultra moror, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 28, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcellus, ut tanta vis ingruebat mali, traduxerat in urbem suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 26, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vero ... exurebatur amoenissimus Italiae ager, villaeque passim incendiis fumabant ... tum prope de integro seditione accensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.— And with <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> in co-ordinate clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">consules, ut ventum ad Cannas est, et in conspectu Poenum habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in extrema juga ventum, et hostes sub oculis erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Poenus apparuit in collibus, et pauci ... adferebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.49" n="(b)" level="5"> Of repeated past actions, <hi rend="ital">whenever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaeque pars castrorum nudata defensoribus premi videbatur, eo occurrere et auxilium ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.50" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">plupf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.51" n="(a)" level="5"> = postquam (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut hinc forte ea ad obstetricem erat missa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad mare nostrae cohortes excubuerant, accessere subito primā luce Pompejani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.52" n="(b)" level="5"> In epistolary style = the Engl. <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras scripsi ... statim ut tuas legeram (= litteras nunc scribo, ut tuas legi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Athenas a. d. VII. Kal. Quinct. veneram, exspectabam ibi jam quartum diem Pomptinium (= ut veni, exspecto),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.53" n="(g)" level="5"> Of repeated past actions, <hi rend="ital">whenever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cujusque sors exciderat ... alacer arma capiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 42, 3</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque istius animum offenderat, in lautumias statim coniciebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quidque ego apprehenderam, statim accusator extorquebat e manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 19, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cuique erat locus attributus, ad munitiones accedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque arma ceperat ... inordinati in proelium ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 27, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ita</hi> as correl.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut enim quisque contra voluntatem ejus dixerat, ita in eum judicium de professione jugerum postulabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.54" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi>, or, in oblique discourse, <hi rend="ital">plupf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, ut quaeque res delata ad nos erit, tum denique scrutari locos debemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:34:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 34, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traditum esse ut quando aqua Albana abundasset, tum ... victoriam de Veientibus dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15, 11</bibl></cit> (for ut after simul, v. simul, VI.).—</sense><sense id="n49975.55" n="C" level="2"> Introducing substantive clauses, <hi rend="ital">that;</hi> always with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (cf. ut as interrog. adverb in dependent clauses, I. A. 3. supra). </sense><sense id="n49975.56" n="1" level="3"> In object clauses. </sense><sense id="n49975.57" n="a" level="4"> In clauses which, if independent, would take the imperative mood, often rendered by the Engl. infinitive. </sense><sense id="n49975.58" n="(a)" level="5"> After verbs denoting<pb n="1942" /> <cb n="UT" />  to wish, request, pray, demand, or invite: <cit><quote lang="la">malim istuc aliis ita videatur quam uti tu, soror, te collaudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem mallem ut ires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem vellem ut pedes haberent (res tuae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo uti mihi respondeas num quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precor (deos) ut his infinitis nostris malis contenti sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulo ut ne quid praejudicati afferatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petebant uti equites praemitterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi instat Hortensius ut eas in consilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ut aliquando fieret, instabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum Dolabellae dixisse (= eum rogasse) ut ad me scriberet (= me rogaret), ut in Italiam quam primum venirem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio ut quod nunc natura et impetus est, fiat judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectutem ut adipiscantur omnes optant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigo a me, non ut optimis par sim, sed ut malis melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 17:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut ne</hi> = ne: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebatio mandavi, ut, si quid te eum velles ad me mittere, ne recusaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Also without verb, like utinam, to express a wish; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. in imprecations (ante-class.): ut te cum tua Monstratione magnus perdat Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illum di deaeque perdant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.59" n="(b)" level="5"> After verbs expressing or implying advice, suggestion, or exhortation: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vos hortari tantum possum ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod suades ut ad Quinctium scribam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi auctor sum ut eum tibi ordinem reconcilies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censeo ut iter reliquum conficere pergas,</quote> <trans><tr>I propose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:71:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 71, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 40, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixeram a principio ut sileremus,</quote> <trans><tr>I had advised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 42, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompejum monebat ut meam domum metueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem suasi ut Romam pergeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Messalae et ipsi Attico dixit ut sine curā essent,</quote> <trans><tr>exhorted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, 5.—</sense><sense id="n49975.60" n="(g)" level="5"> After verbs expressing resolution or agreement to do something: <cit><quote lang="la">rus ut irem jam heri constitiveram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decrevistis ut de praemiis militum primo quoque tempore referretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitueram ut pridie Idus Aquini manerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuunt ut decem millia hominum in oppidum submittantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubal paciscitur cum Celtiberorum principibus ut copias inde abducant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos induxisse in animum, ut superbo quondam regi, tum infesto exuli proderent (patriam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 25, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne plebi cum patribus essent conubia sanxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:27:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 27, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitia urbem ut incenderent conjurarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 45, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.61" n="(d)" level="5"> After verbs of command or prohibition: <cit><quote lang="la">imperat Laelio ut per collis circumducat equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 33, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud praecipiendum fuit ut ... diligentiam adhiberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Aemilio senatus negotium dat ut Patavinorum seditionem comprimeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul edicere est ausus ut senatus ad vestitum rediret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet sententiam ut dicant suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tibi in mentem non venit jubere ut haec quoque referret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 28</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis praedixit, ut ne prius Lacedaemoniorum legatos dimitteret, quam ipse esset remissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Verbs expressing permission: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ille legem mihi de XII. tabulis recitavit quae permittit ut furem noctu liceat occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Tull. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedo tibi ut ea praetereas quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabis mihi hanc veniam ut eorum ... auctoritatem Graecis anteponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille tibi potestatem facturus est ut eligas utrum velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud natura non patitur ut aliorum spoliis nostras facultates augeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.62" n="b" level="4"> In dependent clauses implying an aim or end. </sense><sense id="n49975.63" n="(a)" level="5"> After verbs denoting direction and inclination of the mind, care, purpose, intention, or striving: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plurimis prosimus enitimur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilior erit ut albam esse nivem probet quam erat Anaxagoras,</quote> <trans><tr>he will be more inclined</tr>, <tr>disposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36, 117</bibl></cit>: ne ille longe aberit ut argumento credat philosophorum, <hi rend="ital">far remote from believing</hi> = <hi rend="ital">not inclined</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 47, 144</bibl>: qui sibi hoc sumpsit ut conrigat mores aliorum, quis huic ignoscat si, <hi rend="ital">who undertakes</hi> <cb n="UT" /> <hi rend="ital">to correct</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem idoneam ut habeas diligenter videbis,</quote> <trans><tr>care</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille intellexit id agi atque id parari ut filiae suae vis afferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater potuit animum inducere ut naturam ipsam vinceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum senatus temptaret ut ipse gereret sine rege rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem ut honore dignus essem, maxime semper laboravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 20, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni contentione pugnatum est ut lis haec capitis existimaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:41:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 41, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis spes ad id versa ut totis viribus terra adgrederentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis cura solet in hoc versari, semper ut boni aliquid efficiam dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se miliens morituros potius quam ut tantum dedecoris admitti patiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 34, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.64" n="(b)" level="5"> Verbs of effecting: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potui tamen Propitiam Venerem facere uti esset mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prior pars orationis tuae faciebat ut mori cuperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas annonae faciebat ut istuc ... tempore magnum videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:92:section=215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 92, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol efficit ut omnia floreant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest praestare ut ea causa melior esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:10:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non committam ut tibi ipse insanire videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di prohibeant, judices, ut hoc praesidium sectorum existimetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effecisti ut viverem et morerer ingratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus nihil aliud actum est quam ut pudor hominibus peccandi demeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 26, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.65" n="(g)" level="5"> Verbs of obtaining: <cit><quote lang="la">Dumnorix a Sequanis impetrat ut per fines suos Helvetios ire patiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid assequitur, nisi hoc ut arent qui ... in agris remanserunt,</quote> <trans><tr>what does he gain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:55:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 55, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile tenuit ut (Chalcidis) portae sibi aperirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 51, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicerunt tribuni ut legem perferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 25, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.66" n="(d)" level="5"> Verbs of inducing and compelling: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ut omnia quae praescripta sunt defendamus necessitate ullā cogimur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitati persuasit ut de finibus suis exirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatione promissi tui moveor ut admoneam te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parhedrum excita ut hortum ipse conducat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille adduci non potest ut ... ne lucem quoque hanc eripere cupiat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impellit alios avaritia, alios iracundia ut levem auditionem pro re compertā habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de clementia scriberem, Nero Caesar, una me vox tua maxime compulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) After verbs implying duty, right, rule, condition, or possibility: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mihi ne ut dubitem quidem relinquatur,</quote> <trans><tr>not even the possibility of doubt</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides inter se dent, Sequani ne itinere Helvetios prohibeant, Helvetii ut sine maleficio transeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ita a majoribus didicisse ut magis virtute quam dolo contenderent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea lenitas hoc exspectavit ut id quod latebat erumperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura) nobis insculpsit in mentibus, ut eos (deos) aeternos et beatos haberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi Metellus non eripuit, hoc etiam addidit ut quererer hoc sociis imperari,</quote> <trans><tr>he gave the additional right</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:68:section=164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 68, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vero conloqui cum Orpheo, Musaeo, Homero liceat, quanti tandem aestimatis?</quote> <trans><tr>the privilege of conversing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondet Socrates sese meruisse ut amplissimis honoribus decoraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:54:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 54, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meruit ut suspendatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia enim non sum dignus prae te ut figam palum in parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—So after dignus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.67" n="c" level="4"> After verbs of fearing, where ut implies a wish contrary to the fear; <hi rend="ital">that not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem frumentariam, ut satis commode supportari posset, timere se dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
