G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ut satis diligenter actum sit in senatu de litteris meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verebar ut redderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin homo amens diripiendam urbem daturus est, vereor ut Dolabella ipse satis nobis prodesse possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veretur Hiempsal ut foedus satis firmum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo ut sustineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o puer, ut sis vitalis, metuo, et majorum ne quis amicus Frigore te feriat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.— So sometimes after video, with weakened force: vide ut sit, nearly = <hi rend="ital">perhaps it is not</hi> (cf. Roby, Gr. 2, p. 280): considerabitis, <cb n="UT" /> vestri similes feminae sintne Romae; <cit><quote lang="la">si enim non sunt, videndum est, ut honeste vos esse possitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—Very rarely ut stands for <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> after verbs of fearing: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nihil minus, quam ut egredi obsessi moenibus auderent, timeri poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 12</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ferulā caedas meritum ... non vereor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 120</bibl></cit> Jan. and Orell. ad loc. —</sense><sense id="n49975.68" n="d" level="4"> In interrogative clauses represented as untrue, rejecting a supposition or thought with indignation (nearly = fierine potest ut): <cit><quote lang="la">me ut quisquam norit, nisi ille qui praebet cibum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ut ulla res frangat, tu ut umquam te corrigas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egone ut te interpellem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater ut in judicio capitis obesse filio debeat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egone ut prolis meae fundam cruorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 927" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 927</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.69" n="2" level="3"> In subject clauses, with impersonal predicates. </sense><sense id="n49975.70" n="a" level="4"> With a predicate adjective. </sense><sense id="n49975.71" n="(a)" level="5"> With the idea of rule, duty, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">id arbitror Adprime in vitā utile esse, ut ne quid nimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est ut de Catuli sententiā dicendum videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarum est et verum ut eos qui nobis carissimi esse debeant, aeque ac nosmet ipsos amemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo hoc sit primum ut demonstremus quem imitetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximum est ut doceam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum est ut te orem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei (Dionysio) ne integrum quidem erat ut ad justitiam remigraret,</quote> <trans><tr>permission</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>. —With predicates, aequum est, par (anteclass. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aequom videtur tibi ut ego alienum quod est Meum esse dicam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non par videtur ... praesente ibus una paedagogus ut siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.72" n="(b)" level="5"> In clauses expressing result and consequence: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificum illud etiam et gloriosum ut Graecis de philosophia litteris non egeant, illud,</quote> <trans><tr>that result of my labors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consentaneum est huic naturae ut sapiens velit gerere et administrare rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 68</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49975.73" n="(g)" level="5"> In clauses represented as real, true, false, certain, or probable (where the <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> might be used): <cit><quote lang="la">concedetur verum esse ut bonos boni diligant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: sin autem illa veriora ut idem interitus animorum et corporum, etc., id. ib 4, 14; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concedant ut hi viri boni fuerin (= concedant vere factum esse ut, etc.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si verum est ut populus Romanus omnis gentes virtute superarit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ipso Roscio potest illud quidem esse falsum ut circumligatus fuerit, angui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est verisimile ut Chrysogonus horum litteras adamarit aut humanitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos verisimile est ut alios indulgentius tractent propter parentis, alios propter futuram posterorum indolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:32:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 32, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rarum est ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:19:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam inusitatum quam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 21, 62</bibl></cit>.—And after potius: <cit><quote lang="la">multi ex plebe spe amissā potius quam ut cruciarentur ... se in Tiberim praecipitaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.74" n="b" level="4"> With predicate nouns. </sense><sense id="n49975.75" n="(a)" level="5"> Expressing the idea of a verb which would require an object clause, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ut aliter facias non est copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romano in hostico morandi causa erat ut hostem ad certamen eliceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus est lex amicitiae ut idem amici semper velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensus fuit senatus ut mature proficisceremur (= decretum est a senatu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit hoc sive meum, sive rei publicae fatum ut in me unum omnis illa inclinatio temporum incumberet,</quote> <trans><tr>ordained by fate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 26, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus est ut eamus ad forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicasque tempus maximum esse ut eat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum est officium ut homo se conservet in naturae statu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus culturae hoc munus est ut efficiat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput illud est ut Lyconem recipias in necessitudinem tuam,</quote> <trans><tr>duty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caput est ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit hoc quoddam inter Scipionem et Laelium jus ut Scipio Laelium observaret parentis loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea ratio in dicendo haec esse solet ut boni quod habeat id amplectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 292</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ratio est ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 11, 34</bibl></cit>: est mos hominum ut <pb n="1943" /> <cb n="UT" /> nolint eundem pluribus excellere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est hoc Gallicae consuetudinis ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.76" n="(b)" level="5"> Expressing result and consequence: <cit><quote lang="la">est hoc commune vitium in magnis liberisque civitatibus ut invidia gloriae comes sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49975.77" n="c" level="4"> With impersonal verbs. </sense><sense id="n49975.78" n="(a)" level="5"> Including the idea of a verb requiring an object clause, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenit, victi utri sint eo proelio, urbem, agrum ... seque uti dederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cum Dejotaro convenit ut ille in meis castris esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placitum est ut in aprico loco considerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea mihi placuit ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:34:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 34, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Appii Claudii senectutem accedebat etiam ut caecus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—So after fit, <hi rend="ital">it happens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit ut naturā ipsā ad ornatius dicendi genus incitemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:83:338" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 83, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest fieri ut res verbosior haec fuerit, illa verior,</quote> <trans><tr>it may be that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 190</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So with accidit, evenit, contigit: accidit ... ut illo itinere veniret Lampsacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen hoc evenit ut in vulgus insipientium opinio valeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam Caesari contigisset ut esset optimo cuique carissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.79" n="(b)" level="5"> Denoting consequence: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo efficitur ut quidquid honestum sit, idem sit utile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur ut dicamus quae beneficia danda sint et quemadmodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur ut causa ponatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:81:331" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 81, 331</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.80" n="(g)" level="5"> Est, in the meaning fit, or causa est: <cit><quote lang="la">est ut plerique philosophi nulla tradant praecepta dicendi,</quote> <trans><tr>it is a fact that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:36:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 36, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est igitur ut mirandum sit ea praesentiri,</quote> <trans><tr>there is no reason for wondering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 56, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando fuit ut quod licet non liceret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 48</bibl></cit>; so, in eo est ut, prope est ut, <hi rend="ital">to be on the point of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be near to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam in eo rem fore ut Romani aut hostes aut domini habendi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam in eo esset ut comprehenderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam prope erat ut ne consulum quidem majestas coërceret iras hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope est ut lamentationem exigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.— Here belongs the circumlocution of the periphrastic future by futurum esse or fore, with <hi rend="ital">ut;</hi> generally in the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrabar fore ut lex de pecuniis repetundis tolleretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 14, 41</bibl></cit>.—Very rarely in the <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">futurum est ut sapiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.81" n="3" level="3"> In attributive clauses, dependent on nouns not belonging to the predicate. </sense><sense id="n49975.82" n="a" level="4"> With the idea of resolve, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vicit sententia ut mitterentur coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam dixit (= censuit) ut judicum comitia haberentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.83" n="b" level="4"> Of agreement: <cit><quote lang="la">fide acceptā ut remitterent eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49975.84" n="c" level="4"> Of law, rule, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores rogationem promulgarunt ut omnes regiae stirpis interficerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum factum est ut M. Fulvius litteras extemplo ad consulem mitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ei est proposita condicio ut aut juste accusaret aut acerbe moreretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Suevi in eam se consuetudinem induxerunt ut locis frigidissimis lavarentur in fluminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49975.85" n="d" level="4"> Of duty: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum poscit ut quod esse ex usu Galliae intellexissent, communi consilio administrarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 8, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49975.86" n="e" level="4"> Of purpose, inclination, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis dent di mentem oportet ut prohibeatis, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>make you inclined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa mihi fuit huc veniendi ut quosdam hinc libros promerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confectio tabularum hanc habet vim (= efficit) ut quidquid fingatur aut non constet, appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.87" n="f" level="4"> Of effect, result, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit ista quondam virtus ut viri fortes acrioribus suppliciis civem perniciosum quam hostem everterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet hoc virtus ut viros fortis species ejus et pulchritudo etiam in hoste posita delectet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 32, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatum poenam sequi oportebat ut igni cremaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.88" n="4" level="3"> In clauses of manner, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so that.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.89" n="a" level="4"> With ita, sic, adeo, tantus, talis, or tam as antecedent (v. hh. vv.; <cit><quote lang="la">anteclass. ut qui = ut): Adeon' me fungum fuisse ut qui illi crederem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.90" n="b" level="4"> With is or hic as antecedent: eos deduxi testes et eas litteras deportavi ut <cb n="UT" /> de istius facto dubium esse nemini possit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi res publica debet esse ut inimicus neque deesse nocenti possit, neque obesse innocenti (ejusmodi = talis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">162: eo perducam servum ut in multa liber sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:19:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eo loco res humanae sunt ut vobis tantum otii supersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 27:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aequitas in tuo imperio fuit, haec praetoris dignitas ut servos Siculorum dominos esse velles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:38:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 38, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc jure sunt socii ut eis ne deplorare quidem de suis incommodis liceat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>, § 65.—</sense><sense id="n49975.91" n="c" level="4"> Without antecedents, <hi rend="ital">so that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus aures clausae veritati sunt ut ab amico verum audire nequeat, hujus salus desperanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in virtute multi sunt ascensus, ut is maximā gloriā excellat qui virtute plurimum praestet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons altissimus impendebat ut perpauci prohibere possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessit quod Domitius Heracleā iter fecerat, ut ipsa fortuna illum obicere Pompejo videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia a patre exacta crudeliter, ut divenditis omnibus bonis aliquamdiu trans Tiberim veluti relegatus viveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama Gallici belli pro tumultu valuit ut et dictatorem dici placeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo minus ... magnas percipiendum voluptates, ut fatendum sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.92" n="d" level="4"> Idiomat. with <hi rend="ital">non.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.93" n="(a)" level="5"> Ut non, when the principal sentence is negative, <hi rend="ital">without</hi>: non possunt unā in civitate multi rem ac fortunam amittere ut non plures secum in eandem trahant calamitatem, <hi rend="ital">without dragging</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaminem Quirinalem neque mittere a sacris neque retinere possumus ut non deum aut belli deseramus curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita fracti animi civitatis erant ut non sentirent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam oculi ejus flectentur ut non quod indignentur inveniant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ajunt, nec honeste quemquam vivere ut non jucunde vivat, nec jucunde ut non honeste quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo in eo quod daturus es gratiam suam facere potest ut non tuam minuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. also: ut non conferam vitam neque existimationem tuam cum illius; <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim est conferenda (= ut omittam conferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.94" n="(b)" level="5"> Non ut, followed by sed quod, causal (= non quod, sed quod; <cit><quote lang="la">rare): earum exempla tibi misi non ut deliberarem reddendaene essent, sed quod non dubito, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>not that ... but because</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad te scribo non ut queas tu demere solitudinem, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—Followed by sed ut: <cit><quote lang="la">benigne accipe (beneficium): rettulisti gratiam, non ut solvisse te putes, sed ut securior debeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:35:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; and in reversed order: quorsum haec praeterita? Quia sequitur illud, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">non ut eas res causam adferrent amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 15, 35</bibl></cit>.—Rarely nedum ut, in the sense of nedum alone, <hi rend="ital">much less that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to mention that</hi> (mostly post-class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Zumpt, Gram. § 573): ne voce quidem incommodā, nedum ut illa vis fieret, paulatim permulcendo mansuefecerant plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 14, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quando enim ... fama in totam urbem penetrat? nedum ut per tot provincias innotescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.95" n="e" level="4"> Conditional or concessive. </sense><sense id="n49975.96" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Granting that</hi> (<hi rend="ital">for argument's sake</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod ut ita sit—nihil enim pugno—quid habet ista res aut laetabile aut gloriosum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ut haec concedantur, reliqua qui tandem intellegi possunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi concedam hoc indignum esse, tu mihi concedas necesse est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae, ut essent vera, conjungi debuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:15:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae natura ut uno consensu juncta sit et continens ... quid habere mundus potest cum thesauri inventione conjunctum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est prudentiā dulcius, quam, ut cetera auferat, adfert certe senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.97" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Even if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">although</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (exercitus) si pacis ... nomen audiverit, ut non referat pedem, insistet certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea pars defensionis relinquatur, quid impediet actionem? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quaeras omnia, quomodo Graeci ineptum appellant non reperies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut enim neminem alium nisi T. Patinam rogasset, scire potuit, illo ipso die a Milone prodi flaminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 17, 46</bibl></cit>: verum ut hoc non sit, tamen praeclarum <cb n="UT" /> spectaculum mihi propono, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:64:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 64, § 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 45, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, ut non omnis peritissimus sim belli, cum Romanis certe bellare didici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque equites armis equisque salvis tantum vim fluminis superasse verisimile est, ut jam Hispanos omnes inflati travexerint utres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at enim, ut jam ita sint haec, quid ad vos, Romani?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 32, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam Macedonia deficiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam ut virtus vestra transire alio possit, fortuna certe loci hujus transferri non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 54, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 50, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ac jam ut omnia contra opinionem acciderent, tamen se plurimum navibus posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut desint vires tamen est laudanda voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dura videatur appellatio, tamen sola est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>, prooem. 15.—Ut maxime = si maxime: <cit><quote lang="la">quaere rationem cur ita videatur: quam ut maxime inveneris ... non tu verum testem habere, sed eum non sine causā falsum testimonium dicere ostenderis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">nihilominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (res) nihilominus, ut ego absim, confici poterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.98" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Provided that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulatiuncula, ut tantum faciamus quantum in Tusculano fecimus, prope dimidio minoris constabit isto loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: dabo egenti, sed ut ipse non egeam; <cit><quote lang="la">succurram perituro, sed ut ipse non peream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.99" n="5" level="3"> In clauses of purpose (final clauses; distinguished from object clauses with ut; v. C. 1., in which the verb itself contains the idea of purpose, the clause completing the idea of the verb), <hi rend="ital">in order that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so as to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49975.100" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin voco, ut me audiat, nomine illam suo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec acta res est uti nobiles restituerentur in civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:51:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 51, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellego, tempus hoc vobis divinitus datum esse ut odio ... totum ordinem liberetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar singulis legionibus singulos legatos praefecit uti eos testes suae quisque virtutis haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>.—And with <hi rend="ital">ut ne</hi>, instead of ne, <hi rend="ital">lest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ut ne fiat, haec res sola est remedio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; v. 1. ne, I. B. 4. a.—Very rarely, <hi rend="ital">ut non</hi> for ne, expressing a negative purpose: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plura non dicam neque aliorum exemplis confirmem quantum valeat (= ut praeteream),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. d. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra.—</sense><sense id="n49975.101" n="b" level="4"> Esp., after certain antecedents. </sense><sense id="n49975.102" n="(a)" level="5"> After id, <hi rend="ital">for the purpose</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">id huc reverti uti me purgarem tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.103" n="(b)" level="5"> After idcirco: <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco amicitiae comparantur ut commune commodum mutuis officiis gubernetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum idcirco omnes servi sumus ut liberi esse possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 53, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.104" n="(g)" level="5"> After ideo and eo: <cit><quote lang="la">non ideo Rhenum insedimus ut Italiam tueremur, sed ne quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marionem ad te eo misi ut aut tecum ad me quam primum veniret, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.105" n="(d)" level="5"> After ad eam rem, ad hoc, in hoc: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam rem vos delecti estis ut eos condemnaretis quos sectores jugulare non potuissent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:52:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 52, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere se facilem ad hoc ut quem obligavit etiam exsolvi velit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:17:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo natus in hoc ut mores liberae civitatis Persica servitute mutaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) After eā mente, hac mente: <cit><quote lang="la">navis onerarias Dolabella eā mente comparavit ut Italiam peteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac mente laborem Sese ferre senes ut in otia tuta recedant Ajunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) After potius quam: <cit><quote lang="la">potius ad delendam memoriam dedecoris, quam ut timorem faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potius quodcumque casus ferat passuros, quam ut sprevisse Tarentinos videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.106" n="c" level="4"> Idiomat. </sense><sense id="n49975.107" n="(a)" level="5"> With the principal predicate, referring to the conception of the writer, understood; mostly parenthet. = the Engl. <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: ut in pauca conferam, testamento facto mulier moritur, <hi rend="ital">to be brief</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid tibi videtur, ut ad fabulas veniamus, senex ille Caecilianus minoris facere filium rusticum?</quote> <trans><tr>to come to the drama</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum judicium de judicibus, et, vere ut dicam, de te futurum est,</quote> <trans><tr>to tell the truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:69:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 69, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Murena, si nemini, ut levissime dicam, odio fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>to say the least</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 40, 87</bibl></cit>: ut nihil de illo tempore, nihil de calamitate rei publicae<pb n="1944" /> <cb n="UTER" />  querar, hoc tibi respondeo, etc., <hi rend="ital">not to complain of that time</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 33, 95</bibl>: quae cum se disposuit, et partibus suis consensit, et, ut ita dicam concinuit, summum bonum tetigit, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so to speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chimes in</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce— ut idem in singulos annos orbis volveretur —Hernici nuntiant Volscos et Aequos reficere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.108" n="(b)" level="5"> Satis ut, <hi rend="ital">enough to</hi> (lit. <hi rend="ital">enough for the purpose of</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">satis esse magna incommoda accepta ut reliquos casus timerent,</quote> <trans><tr>disasters large enough to make them afraid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49975.109" n="(g)" level="5"> Quam ut after comparatives, <hi rend="ital">too much to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod praeceptum, quia major erat quam ut ab homine videretur, idcirco adsignatum est deo,</quote> <trans><tr>too great to come from man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:16:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non intellegit, Canachi signa rigidiora esse quam ut imitentur veritatem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarior res erat quam ut tegi ac dissimulari posset,</quote> <trans><tr>too clear to be covered up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentius jam id malum apparuit quam ut minores per magistratus sedaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est tamen aliquis minor quam ut in sinu ejus condenda sit civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utcumque: <entryFree id="n49976" type="main" key="utcumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ut-cumque</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-cunq-</orth>; ante-class. ut quomque), <pos>adv.</pos> <sense id="n49976.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In what way soever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">howsoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n49976.1" n="A" level="2"> Conjunctive, with independent verb and correl.-clause: <cit><quote lang="la">(orator) utcumque se affectum videri et animum audientis moveri volet, ita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utquomque animo conlubitumst meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utquomque in alto ventus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque erit, juvabit tamen, etc., Liv. praef. § 3: utcumque esset igitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque res sese habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 37, 54, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">42, 40, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque casura res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix! utcumque ferent ea facta minores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque se ea res habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque res postularet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque aut locus opportunitatem daret, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49976.2" n="B" level="2"> Simply limiting a <hi rend="ital">verb</hi> or <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in any way whatever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in one way or another</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae dubiis in rebus utcumque tolerata essent, ea non ultra pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 15, 1</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudentes utcumque compositā cum Philippo pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 15, 10</bibl></cit>. —So ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed utcumque, seu injuncta seu suscepta foret militia, et eam exhaustam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>however it might be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quoque temptata utcumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:66:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 66, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum utcumque explicaretur agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:66:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 66, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committendam rerum summam in discrimen utcumque ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arduum et impeditum saxis iter primo utcumque tolerabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:34" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegitur enim utcumque dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen esset (securitas) utcumque tolerabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:21" default="NO">4, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:11" default="NO">2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo difficilis est hominibus utcumque conceptae spei mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:67:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 67, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49976.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to ut, I. B. 5.) <hi rend="ital">At whatever time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whenever</hi>, = quandocumque (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque exaestuat aut deficit mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 42, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque defecere mores, Indecorant bene nata culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibimus, ibimus, Utcumque praecedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque mecum vos eritis, libens Insanientem navita Bosporum Temptabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utens: <entryFree id="n49977" type="main" key="u_tens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of utor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49978" type="main" key="Utens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Utens</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Utīs</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ou)/teis, entos</foreign>, <sense id="n49978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Cisalpine Gaul</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Montone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 3</bibl>; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vitis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
utensilis: <entryFree id="n49979" type="main" key="u_tensi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtensĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>utor</etym>, in econom. lang., <sense id="n49979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be used</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit for use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49979.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in Italiā utensile non modo non nascitur, sed etiam non egregium fit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: quid utensile, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 22.—</sense><sense id="n49979.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtensilĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things for use</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">utensils</hi>, <hi rend="ital">materials</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necessaries</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex, vasa): utensilia, quibus aut alitur hominum genus aut etiam excolitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: exutus omnibus utensilibus miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina humanaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 33, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 22, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes collectis utensilibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:9" default="NO">2, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:3" default="NO">1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
utensilitas: <entryFree id="n49980" type="hapax" key="u_tensi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtensĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>utensilis</etym>, <sense id="n49980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fitness for use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri et aeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uter: <entryFree id="n49981" type="main" key="u_ter1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n49981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form of <cb n="UTER" /> <number>plur.</number> utria, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 231, 31</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> utrium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 1</bibl>) [kindr. with uterus; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 6, 7</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">a bag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bottle</hi> made of an animal's hide, <hi rend="ital">a skin</hi> for wine, oil, water, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctos salire per utres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 384</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 7, 15, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:240" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 18, 73, § 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 84" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 3</bibl>. —Often inflated and used for crossing streams, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48</bibl> Herz.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 176</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: crescentem tumidis infla sermonibus utrem, <hi rend="ital">the swelling skin</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the vain man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49982" type="main" key="u^ter2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭter</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. uterus <sense id="n49982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n49983" type="main" key="u^ter3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭter</orth>, <itype>ū^tra, ū^trum</itype> (<sense id="n49983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> utrī^us; <case>dat.</case> utri; <hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi>, scanned utrĭus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 15</bibl>; cf. uterque; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. fem.</hi> utrae, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 132</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> [for cuter, in form <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> of quis; cf. Engl. who, whe - ther; cf. also Sanscr. katara, uter, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">po/teros</foreign>; Ionic, <foreign lang="greek">ko/teros</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n49983.1" n="I" level="1"> Interrogatively. </sense><sense id="n49983.2" n="A" level="2"> In direct questions. </sense><sense id="n49983.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. part.;</hi> sed uter vostrorum'st celerior? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnūm horum uter est pinguior?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter nostrum popularis est? tune an ego?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter est insanior horum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccat uter nostrum cruce dignius?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49983.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter ex his tibi sapiens videtur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49983.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> and with <hi rend="ital">apposit.-clause</hi>: utrum est melius? virginemne an viduam uxorem ducere? Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 136, 7</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 53 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">utrum igitur mavis? statimne nos vela facere, an ... paululum remigare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:37:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 37, § 84</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">plur. verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter meruistis culpam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter eratis, tun' an ille, major?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 60</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, of two parties: <cit><quote lang="la">sed utriscum rem esse mavis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49983.6" n="B" level="2"> In indirect questions. </sense><sense id="n49983.7" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum uter sit blandior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum duarum condicionum utram malis vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: is vestrorum uter sit, cui signum datum est, Cette, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 4</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 62 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod utri nostrum sanctius sit, jam pridem sentis Liv 40, 9, 7: utrius horum Verba probes et facta, doce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49983.8" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: de praemiis quaeritur: ex duobus, uter dignior; <cit><quote lang="la">ex pluribus, quis dignissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49983.9" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">utrum de his potius, dubitasset aliquis, quin alterum, nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:189" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 50, 189</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n49983.10" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: omnibus cura viris uter esset induperator, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 86 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">et tamen utrum malis scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utro frui malis, optio sit tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortirenturve, uter comitiis ejus anni praeesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tantum utrum melius, sed quid sit optimum quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dijudicari, uter populus alteri pariturus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:90:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 90, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elige, utrum facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorante rege uter Orestes esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">considerando, utra lex ad majores res pertineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitare visus est Sulpicius et Cotta, utrius oratio propius ad veritatem videretur accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut oculis, in utram partem fluit (flumen), judicari non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen consulibus inciderat, uter dedicaret aedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videamus uter plus scribere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, of two parties or sets: <cit><quote lang="la">sed utros ejus habueris libros—duo enim sunt corpora—an utrosque, nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio sequitur ex ipsis (testibus), utri meliores viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec promptum est dicere, utros peccare validius putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">apposit. - clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitare, utrum esset Agrigentinis utilius, suisne servire anne populo Romano obtemperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videte utrum sit aequius, hominem dedi inimicissimis nationibus an reddi amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 18, 41</bibl></cit> (14, 31).—</sense><sense id="n49983.11" n="5" level="3"> Repeated, <hi rend="ital">which of two ... the other</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil jam aliud quaerere debeatis, nisi uter utri insidias fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ... neque dijudicari posset, uter utri virtute anteferendus videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire de filiis tuis, uter ab utro petitus fraude et insidiis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambigitur uter utro sit prior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non intellegitur, uter ab utro eversus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9</bibl></cit>, <cb n="UTER" /> 2, 45.—</sense><sense id="n49983.12" n="6" level="3"> Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterne Ad casus dubios fidet sibi certius, hic qui Pluribus assuerit mentem, etc., An qui contentus parvo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49983.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49983.14" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Indef. rel.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whichsoever</hi> of two, <hi rend="ital">the one which</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utram harum vis condicionem accipe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convenit, victi utri sint in eo proelio ... focos, seque uti dederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum utro uti nolumus, altero est utendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum enim horum dixeris, in eo culpa et crimen haerebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:45:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 45, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens ille tibi optionem facturus sit, ut eligas utrum velis, factum esse necne ... utrum dixeris, id contra te futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum igitur eorum accidisset, verum oraculum fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter enim ... penetrarit et uter ... accesserit, is vincat necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:36:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 36, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum placet, sumite ... daret, utrum vellet subclamatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 18, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utri eorum dedicatio jussu populi data esset, eum praeesse annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrius partis melior fortuna belli esset, ad ejus societatem inclinaturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter aedilis fueritve Vestrum praetor, is sacer esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 180</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utro exercitu mallet ex duobus, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipse optet, ex duobus ab lege constitutis suppliciis utrum velit pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7:23:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49983.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">either</hi> of the two, <hi rend="ital">one or the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one</hi> of two: uti tu ad Laelium Luciumve consulem sive quem ad uter eorum jusserit proferes, Vet. Form. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium controversiarum, quae essent inter aratorem et decumanum, si uter velit, edicit se recuperatores daturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: quid? si una tabula sit, duo naufragi aeque sapientes; <cit><quote lang="la">sibine uter rapiat, an alter cedat alteri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cum utro eorum actum est, cum altero agi non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:45:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 45, § 3</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n49983.16" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Whichsoever</hi> of more than two: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum utrum ei acciderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit>— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">to which of two places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to which side</hi> or <hi rend="ital">part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit utro potius ruat et ruere ardet utroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 179</bibl>; v. also utrum.</sense></entryFree>
uterculus: <entryFree id="n49984" type="hapax" key="u^tercu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtercŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>uterus</etym>, <sense id="n49984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small paunch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utercumque: <entryFree id="n49985" type="main" key="u^tercumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭter-cumque</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cunq-</orth>), <itype>utrăcumque, utrumcumque</itype>, <sense id="n49985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49985.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Whichever of the two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whichsoever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whichever</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">magnae utrimque copiae ita paratae ad depugnandum esse dicuntur, ut, utercumque vicerit, non sit mirum futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo bello, non, utracumque pars vicisset, tamen aliqua forma esset futura rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:15:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res, utrocumque dicitur modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumcumque erit, prima sit curarum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5</bibl>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: ne sententia sua, utramcumque in partem dicta esset, ipsa sese rescinderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49985.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrocumque modo sequetur summa confusio,</quote> <trans><tr>either way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl>, praef. § 11; 12, 10, 59.</sense></entryFree>
uterinus: <entryFree id="n49986" type="main" key="u^te^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uterus</etym>, <sense id="n49986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born of the same mother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uterine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 61, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 59, 15</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 9, 42, 9, § 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:43:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 43, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uterlibet: <entryFree id="n49987" type="main" key="u^terli^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭter-lĭbet</orth>, <itype>utrălĭbet, utrumlĭbet</itype>, <sense id="n49987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49987.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Which of the two you please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whichsoever of the two</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">utrumlibet elige, alterum incredibile est, alterum nefarium et ante hoc tempus utrumque inauditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 26, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49987.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">either one</hi> (of two), <hi rend="ital">either of the two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos consules esse, quorum utrolibet duce bellum Etruscum geri recte possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 24, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non dicere, si utrum libet esset liberum, maluissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingamus utrumlibet non recte dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:18" default="NO">6, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si parti utrilibet omnino alteram detrahas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi utrolibet modo curatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjecto vel irino vel laureo oleo, sic ut utrilibet paulum aceti misceatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem fluentem ex utrālibet parte sistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 4, 8, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in utramlibet partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 101" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 101</bibl></cit>: 255.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49987.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtrālĭbet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">on whichever of two sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on either side</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 18, 16, § 79</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49987.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtrōlĭbet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to either one of two sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to either side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne inclinata utrolibet cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uterque: <entryFree id="n49988" type="main" key="u^terque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭter-que</orth>, <itype>utrăque, utrumque</itype> (<sense id="n49988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> utriusque, always with ĭ, Plaut. Truc <pb n="1945" /> <cb n="UTER" /> 4, 3, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 503</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 506</bibl>; old <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. sing. fem.</hi> utraeque, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, 3, p. 132</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> utrumque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 129</bibl> B. and K.), <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each</hi> (of two), <hi rend="ital">either</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one and the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one as well as the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both</hi> (applied to two subjects regarded severally, while ambo regards the two as a pair; cf. Zumpt, Gr. § 141, Anm. 2). </sense><sense id="n49988.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49988.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n49988.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49988.4" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperator uterque hinc et illinc Jovi Vota suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: tibi in utrāque parte pollet et pariter potest, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 375, 5</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 226 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">causae utriusque figurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 503</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1212" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1212</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quascumque (insulas) in liquentibus stagnis Marique vasto fert uterque Neptunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parique fastigio steterit in utrāque fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docte sermones utriusque linguae,</quote> <trans><tr>Greek and Latin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">insignis utriusque linguae monimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid ... gentes ab utroque jacentes Oceano numerem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 829</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora sub utroque jacentia Phoebo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the rising and the setting sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:338" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutu (Jovis) tremefactus uterque Est polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:489" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limes uterque poli,</quote> <bibl
