n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:157" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus est in utroque parente,</quote> <trans><tr>father and mother</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam tempus esset deducendi ab Samnio exercitus aut utriusque aut certe alterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densis ictibus heros Creber utrāque manu pulsat versatque Dareta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen utriusque Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 13:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49988.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp. in the phrase in utramque partem, <hi rend="ital">in either way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for and against</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vemens in utramque partem es nimis, Aut largitate nimiā aut parsimoniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam vim esse in fortunā in utramque partem, vel ad secundas res, vel ad adversas, quis ignorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in utramque partem disserere = pro et contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 27, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utramque in partem multa dicuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna est vis conscientiae, et magna in utramque partem, ut neque timeant ... et putent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam sententiam in utramque partem esse tutam,</quote> <trans><tr>on either assumption</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49988.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n49988.7" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequom'st, quod in rem esse utrique arbitremur, Et mihi te et tibi me consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conveniunt adhuc utriusque verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum utrique mos geratur amborum ex sententiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed uterque (sapiens appellatus est) alio quodam modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aut uterque inter se aut neuter satis duret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mihi videris utrumque facturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare qui utrumque voluit et potuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque cum equitatu veniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic, qui utrumque probat, ambobus debuit uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: cum utrique sis maxime necessarius, Balb. et Opp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, A, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. unus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tibi non utriusque petenti copia facta'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque fide pignus dextras utriusque poposcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium est utriusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:27:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset et aequalis Mars utriusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 29:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 29, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49988.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., in apposit. with nouns or clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Antiphonem uterque, mater et pater, Quasi deditā operā domi erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas atque Coccejus, missi magnis de rebus uterque Legati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> S 1, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego utrumque meum puto esse, et quid sentiam ostendere et quod feceris defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> understood: <cit><quote lang="la">verum, Demea, Curemus aequam uterque partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; so freq. with <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi> where the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> would be ambiguous (cf. 3. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">id utrumque tardum fructum reddit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 176</bibl></cit>: quod (aquam et pabulum) utrumque large palus praebere poterat, Auct. B. Alex. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Once with <hi rend="ital">nom. masc.</hi>: nam qui instat alicui ... aut contra de alicujus periculo festinatur, is uterque infestus dicitur, Nigid. ap. Gell 9, 12, 6.—</sense><sense id="n49988.9" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. part.</hi> (class. with <hi rend="ital">pers. pronn.</hi>, etc.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Zumpt, Gr. § 429): utrique nostrum gratum admodum feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque nostrum id sibi suscipiendum putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum uterque ita cecidit victus ut victor idem regnaverit ... utrique horum secunda fortuna regnum est largita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:25:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 25, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus utriusque nostrum aedificatur strenue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: cum eorum,<cb n="UTER" />  de quibus dicimus, aut utrumque, aut unum quodque certe concluditur verbo, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 27, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante utriusque horum obitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:103:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 103, 1</bibl></cit>; v. also I. B. 1. and 3. infra.—Also with <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>, accompanied by <hi rend="ital">adj. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum enim rerum utramque a corde proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 52, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum civitatum utraque foederata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum generum in utroque magnus noster Cato est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utriusque harum rerum expers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> alone (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">et haec utinam Viscorum laudet uterque!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque legatorum et quisquis ... remissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:50:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post utriusque adulescentium obitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:103:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 103, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obiit, utroque liberorum superstite, Tiberio Drusoque Neronibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n49988.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49988.11" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">plur. predic.</hi> (rare in the best prose; not in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra): uterque insaniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde uterque imperator in medium exeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 1</bibl>, A, 2, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, supra: <cit><quote lang="la">facite ut uterque sublimiter stent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 70, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque eorum ex castris exercitum ducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae (naves) conflixerunt, ut utraque ex concursu laborarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque cum illo gravis inimicitias exercebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utraque festinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque ambigui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque opibus perviguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decernitur ut uterque in regnum restituantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 20</bibl>; cf. <number>plur.</number> in consecutive clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">hic cum uterque me intueretur, seseque ad audiendum significarent paratos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit> Madvig ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum utrumque audivi, cum mihi nihil sane praeter sedulitatem probarent, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49988.12" n="2" level="3"> With predicate in first or second person (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sed uterque mensuram implevimus, ego et tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 54 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo inter me et te interest, si uterque habere volumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque magnum beneficium dedistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 4</bibl></cit> (8), 24, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">quod uterque cuperemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Am. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Am. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 14</bibl>, II. B. infra.—</sense><sense id="n49988.13" n="3" level="3"> In reciprocal uses, one ... <hi rend="ital">the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each ... the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">either ... the other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one another</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n49988.14" n="(a)" level="5"> Uterque repeated in another case (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quia uterque utrique est cordi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum uterque utrique esset exercitus in conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl></cit> (al. uterque utrimque): <cit><quote lang="la">cum uterque utrique insidiaretur, Auct. B. Alex. 4, 1: uterque utrumque vituperato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Fragm. p. 131" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Fragm. p. 131</bibl></cit> Durdr.—</sense><sense id="n49988.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With a case of <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita est utraque res sine alterā debilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum uterque suo studio delectatus contempsit alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum enim uterque alteri obiciat, palam est utrumque fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:168" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invictum tamen ab altero utrumque servavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arceri utrumque genus ab altero narrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Ascon. ad Cic. Mil. § 30.—</sense><sense id="n49988.16" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49988.17" n="A" level="2"> Regularly of two parties, sets, or classes, each including a plurality: Praenestini et Lanuvini hospites: suopte utrosque decuit acceptos cibo, etc., Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 18, 6</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 21 Rib.): non cauponantes bellum sed belligerantes, Ferro non auro vitam cernamus utrique, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 202 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">utrosque pergnovi probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam utrique Socratici et Platonici volumus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus utrisque (actoribus et poëtis) summittitur aliquid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego utrosque in eodem genere praedatorum direptorumque pono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his utrisque (Atrebatis et Viromanduis) persuaserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetolorum utraeque manus Heracleam sese incluserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 76:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 76, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrique (plebis fautores et senatus) victoriam crudeliter exercebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 38, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; cf.: hic igitur Q. Ligarius ... nunc a te supplex fratris salutem petit: quam hujus admonitus officio cum utrisque his dederis, tris fratres optimos ... rei publicae condonaveris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">two</hi> brothers on one side and Ligarius on the other, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 12, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius impigre suorum et hostium res pariter attendere, cognoscere, quid boni utrisque aut contra esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 2</bibl></cit>: cujus flamma ut ab oppidanis et oppugnatoribus est visa, utrisque venit in opinionem,<cb n="UTER" />  etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 3</bibl>.—So with collective nouns: <cit><quote lang="la">primo impetu simul utraque cornua et Numidae pulsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utraque oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 54, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utraeque nationes Rheno praetexuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49988.18" n="B" level="2"> Freq. also of two individual subjects, esp. when regarded as belonging together (cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 1175): <cit><quote lang="la">nec clam te est quam illi utraeque nunc inutiles Et ad pudicitiam et ad rem tutandam sient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc beneficio utrique ab utrisque vero devincimini, Ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrique imperatores exeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit> Ussing (Fleck., uterque imperator): sed qui utrosque error vos agitat, Expedibo, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 505, 7</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 175 Rib.): suis utrisque superstitibus praesentibus istam viam dico, Leg. Form. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">binos habebam (scyphos): jnbeo promi utrosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae fuerunt Ariovisti uxores ... utraeque in eā fugā perierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi utrique ad urbem imperatores erant (Q. Marcius et Q. Metellus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ferox inopia rei familiaris et conscientia scelerum, quae utraque eis artibus auxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa utrosque (patrem et aviam) intuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmas utrasque tetendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod utrorum Dionysiorum opibus Corinthi saepe adjuti fuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrique (Mithridates et Datames) locum qui explorarent mittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare senis utraque consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrisque consulibus Italia decreta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in invidiā censores cum essent ... Cn. Baebius diem ad populum utrisque dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 37, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 17, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 25, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">42, 54, 8: Suillium accusandis utrisque immittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Natalem multa cum Scaevino collocutum, et esse utrosque C. Pisonis intimos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 55</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater filiam, avia neptem, illa utrosque intuens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam Mago Cambyses aures utrasque praeciderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:7:8" default="NO">9, 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crederes imperatum, ut acies utraeque tela cohiberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 35</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n49988.19" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtrōquĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n49988.20" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place, <hi rend="ital">to both places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parts</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in both directions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utroque citius quam vellemus, cursum confecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus utroque ducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactantem utroque caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc huc, nunc illuc et utroque sine ordine curro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit, utro potius ruat, et ruere ardet utroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 166</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n49988.21" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in both directions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in either point of view</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both ways</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores utroque trahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium maxime et moderatum utroque consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utroque firmiores qui in callibus versentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49988.22" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., connected with <hi rend="ital">versum</hi> (<hi rend="ital">vorsum;</hi> sometimes written in one word, utroqueversum): <cit><quote lang="la">utroque vorsum rectum est ingenium meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: accidit, ut quaedam vocabula ambigua sint et utroque versum dicantur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in a twofold sense</hi>, denoting augmentation or diminution, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49988.23" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtrasquĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to the analogy of alias, alteras), <hi rend="ital">both times</hi> (ante-class.): in Hispaniā pugnatum bis: utrasque nostri loco moti, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 183, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 183:25" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 183, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uterus: <entryFree id="n49989" type="main" key="u^te^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭter</orth>, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 188, 15</bibl>; <sense id="n49989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtĕ-rum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 10</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 229, 33</bibl>; Turp. and Afran. ib.) [Sanscr. uttara, later; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(/steros</foreign>; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(ste/ra</foreign>, womb; Sanscr. udaram, belly; Engl. udder], <hi rend="ital">the womb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matrix</hi> (syn. volva). </sense><sense id="n49989.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">utero exorti dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perii, mea nutrix, uterum dolet!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 96</bibl>: quae te beluam ex utero, non hominem fudit, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 97</bibl>; Hirt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:100" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 280</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 315</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:452" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 452</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n49989.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n49989.3" n="A" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">the cavities</hi> of the earth, from which the first creatures are represented to have come forth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 806</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n49989.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the womb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fetus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae uterum gerentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pregnant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 62, § 151</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49989.5" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paunch</hi>: me puero uterus erat solarium: ubi iste monebat esse, etc., Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 499</bibl>; <pb n="1946" /> <cb n="UTIL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:309" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 309</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:773" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 773</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of swans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 47, 66, § 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49989.6" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate things; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Trojan horse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lato utero (navium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utervis: <entryFree id="n49990" type="main" key="u^tervi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭter-vīs</orth>, <itype>utrăvis, utrumvis</itype>, <sense id="n49990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. indef.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which of the two you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">either one of the two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">either</hi> (be it which it may) <hi rend="ital">of the two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui utramvis recte norit, ambas noverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si utrumvis horum umquam tibi visus forem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at minus habeo virium quam vestrum utervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel ego amare utramvis possim, si probe appotus siem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tange utramvis digitulo minimo modo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut utrumvis salvo officio se facere posse arbitrarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">in aurem utramvis otiose dormire,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be free from care</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> De istac re in oculum utrumvis conquiescito. <hi rend="ital">Cal.</hi> Utrum oculum anne aurem? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> At hoc pervolgatumst nimis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 121</bibl> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)p) a)mfote/ra kaqeu/dein</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">ta\ w)=ta</foreign>, Menand. Fragm. C. G. F. 4, 189).</sense></entryFree>
uti: <entryFree id="n49991" type="main" key="u_ti1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūti</orth>, <sense id="n49991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> of utor.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n49992" type="main" key="u^ti_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtī</orth>, v. ut <sense id="n49992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
utibilis: <entryFree id="n49993" type="main" key="u_ti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>utor</etym>, <sense id="n49993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be used</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi> (colloq. and ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non utibilis hic locus factis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 6, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rem utibile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid minus utibile fuit quam hoc ulcus tangere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: neque aqua utibilis reperta, Auct. Itin. Alex. 37.</sense></entryFree>
utica: <entryFree id="n49994" type="main" key="U^ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŭtĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n49994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very old town in</hi> Africa Propria, <hi rend="ital">north of Carthage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the younger Cato killed himself</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Boushater</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 13</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŭtĭcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Utica</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus, Auct. B. Afr. 68, 4: ptisana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 15, § 75</bibl></cit>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 113</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ŭtĭcenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Utica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 36</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 87, 2 sq.</sense></entryFree>
utilis: <entryFree id="n49995" type="main" key="u_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>utor</etym>. <sense id="n49995.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n49995.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageous</hi>, etc. (cf. commodus). </sense><sense id="n49995.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae hamae utiles sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non faciat quod utile sit, quod expediat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utiles et salutares res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Sophocles et Aeschylus utile ferrent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quernaque glans victa est utiliore cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:676" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 676</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49995.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam id mihi sit facile atque utile, Aliorum exempla commonent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec clam te est, quam illi utraeque res nunc utiles Et ad pudicitiam et ad rem tutandam sient,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si eam legem vobis adcommodatam atque utilem esse intellegerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: sic fuit utilius finiri ipsique tibique, id. Tusc. poët. 1, 48, 115; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim mihi est vita utilior quam animi talis affectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit> dub.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui utiles esse amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: quod tibi utilissimum erit consilii capies, Dolab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci muniti et sibi utiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 1</bibl></cit>.—So with <case>dat.</case> of thing benefited: <cit><quote lang="la">fons ... Infirmo capiti fluit utilis, utilis alvo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: vivit siliquis et pane secundo; <cit><quote lang="la">Militiae quamquam piger et malus, utilis urbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glycyrrhizae sucus utilissimus voci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 9, 11, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmae non utiles stomacho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 51, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver utile silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 323</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 138.—</sense><sense id="n49995.4" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem hominem inveniemus ad eam rem utilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 52</bibl> (supra, A. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">nonne igitur sapiens, si fame ipse conficiatur, abstulerit cibum alteri, homini ad nullam rem utili?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque herba potens ad opem radixque medendi Utilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49995.5" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">abl. instr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter et viciens volneratus est, ob id neutrā manu, neutro pede satis utilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus, naribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis pomis utilis arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49995.6" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (poët.): <cit><quote lang="la">adspirare et adesse choris erat utilis (tibia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 204</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49995.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">what is useful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the useful</hi>: omne tulit punctum,<cb n="UTIL" />  qui miscuit utile dulci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 343</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus atque fidus Judex honestum praetulit utili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilium tardus provisor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae de utilibus honestisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 29</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n49995.8" n="C" level="2"> Utile est, with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum castigare ob meritam noxiam ... est utile Et conducibile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam est utile peccare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimirum sapere est abjectis utile nugis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id arbitror Apprime in vitā esse utile, ut ne quid nimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu, si arbitrarere utile exque re publicā esse, persequerere bello Dolabellam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilissimum ratus inpendentem evitare tempestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49995.9" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n49995.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adapted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">utilissimus ad vitilia holoschoenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic castrensibus utilis armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 19: <cit><quote lang="la">utilium bello studiosus equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxinus hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum Navigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passo psithia utilior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus fistulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventri lactuca movendo utilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:52:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lapathum) silvestre ad multa medicamina utile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 60, § 185</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix medendi Utilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 147</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n49995.11" n="B" level="2"> In jurid. lang.: utilis actio, exceptio, interdictum, judicium, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">which was brought on general principles of justice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in cases for which there was no express legal provision</hi>, or, as we say, <hi rend="ital">in equity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:5:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 5, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:22" default="NO">39, 3, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:41" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:1:section=35 sq" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 20, 1, § 35 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:2:section=11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 2, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">usefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantageously.</hi> </sense><sense id="n49995.12" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">utiliter a naturā permotiones istas animis nostris datas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ne laudarent iracundiam et dicerent utiliter a naturā datam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utiliter in certamen respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 28, 19, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:8" default="NO">6, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serviet utiliter (captivus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 70 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilius starent etiam nunc moenia Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 67</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Cicerone quidem utilissime praedicta sunt omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49995.13" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">rightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">duly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lawfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:97" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:45" default="NO">45, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:46" default="NO">45, 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere ex empto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:30" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 1, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
utilitas: <entryFree id="n49996" type="main" key="u_ti^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n49996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> utilitatum and utilitatium), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>utilis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usefulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expediency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi> (used equally in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">commodis utilitatique servire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enitendum est, ut ostendas, in eā re, quam defendas, aut dignitatem inesse aut utilitatem ... nihil ad utilitatem suam referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi nulla sit utilitas ex amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ea (justitia) quae propter utilitatem constituitur, utilitate aliā convellitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidunt multae saepe causae, quae conturbent animos utilitatis specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam secundum naturam quam utilitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitas justi prope mater et aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persaepe evenit, ut utilitas cum honestate certet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:25:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 25, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus est familiā, si utilitate judicandum est, optima, si forma, vix mediocri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin' ego oculis utilitatem obtineo sincere an parum?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have I the right use of my eyes? do I see aright?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā re utilitatem ego faciam ut cognoscas meam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>how useful I can be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si et belli utilitatem et pacis dignitatem retinere vultis,</quote> <trans><tr>what is useful for war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque de fortitudine quid detrahitur neque de utilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:38:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 38, § 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de utilitatibus, nihil de commodis suis cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura consultrix et provida utilitatum opportunitatumque omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitates ex amicitiā maximae capientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Trio) mirabiles utilitates mihi praebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque Alexandrinum bellum gerente utilitatibus tuis paruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitatibus tuis possum carere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I can do without your services</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitates aut in constituendis aut in conservandis civitatibus constitutas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
utiliter: <entryFree id="n49997" type="main" key="u_ti^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. utilis <sense id="n49997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="UTIQ" /></sense></entryFree>
utinam: <entryFree id="n49998" type="main" key="u^ti^nam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtĭ-nam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ut, II. A.</etym>, a particle or wishing, <sense id="n49998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oh that! I wish that! if only! would to heaven! would that!</hi> etc. </sense><sense id="n49998.1" n="I" level="1"> Affirm atively. </sense><sense id="n49998.2" n="A" level="2"> Alone. </sense><sense id="n49998.3" n="1" level="3"> With primary tenses: <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Hem! aspecta: rideo. <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Utinam, male qui mihi volunt, sic ri deant! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam quae dicis, dictis facta suppetant!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam mea mihi modo auferam quae huc adtuli salva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam id sit, quod spero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam sciam ita esse istuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque utinam ipse Varro incumbat in causam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tibur) Sit meae sedes utinam senectae!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam hinc abierit in malam crucem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui quidem utinam vere fideliter abundiente auguraverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:8:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit> (from <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 469, 15</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n49998.4" n="2" level="3"> With secondary tenses: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Homo hic ebrius est. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Utinam ita essem! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam lex esset eadem, quae uxori est, viro!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam esset mihi Pars aequa amoris tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam, Quirites, virorum fortium atque innocentium copiam tantam haberetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam promissa liceret Non dare!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Fugit te ratio. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> O utinam istuc pugni fecissent tui! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod utinam ipse fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o utinam primis arsisses ignibus infans Idque ego passa forem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque utinam aut verus furor ille aut creditus esset Nec comes hic Phrygias umquam venisset ad arces!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49998.5" n="3" level="3"> Elliptically, without a verb: <cit><quote lang="la">habetis sermonem bene longum hominis, utinam non impudentis!</quote> <trans><tr>not</tr>, <tr>I trust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:88:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 88, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris ... cursus quid efficiat, exspecto: utinam aliquid simile Parthicis rebus (sc. efficiat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego adero, atque utinam tu quoque eodem die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 22, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n49998.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp. after <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: Quod utinam me suis arquitenes telis mactasset dea! Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 341, 25</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 52 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod utinam inspectare possis timorem de illo meum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod utinam minus vitae cupidi fuissemus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, p. 359, 22</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">elliptically: quod utinam, iterum utinam, tuo tamen commodo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 48, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n49998.7" n="II" level="1"> Negatively: utinam ne and utinam non (equally in use), <hi rend="ital">oh that ... not; would that ... not</hi>: utinam ne in nemore Pelio securibus Caesa accidisset abiegna ad terram trabes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:16:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 16, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod utinam ne Phormioni id suadere in mentem incidisset!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud utinam ne vere scriberem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad te die natali meo scripsi, quo utinam susceptus non essem, aut ne quid ex eādem matre postea natum esset!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clitus utinam non coëgisset me sibi irasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam liberorum nostrorum mores non ipsi perderemus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinamque non pejora vincant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam non inquinasset (Afranius) argumenta puerorum foedis amoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam nec ... nec,</quote> <trans><tr>would that neither ... nor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 6 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
utique: <entryFree id="n49999" type="main" key="u^ti^que^1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtĭ-quĕ</orth>, <sense id="n49999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">and that</hi>, v. ut (uti) and que.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50000" type="main" key="u^ti^que^2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtĭ-quĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ut, I., and therefore, prop., in whatever way, be it as it may; hence</etym>, a restrictive particle of confirmation, <sense id="n50000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in any case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at any rate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by all means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without fail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undoubtedly</hi>, etc., = certe, saltem (good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. for the most part only in epistolary style): velim, Varronis et Lollii mittas laudationem, Lollii utique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vero utique scire cupio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 9, 2: nam et Piliae satisfaciendum est et utique Atticae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagoras et Plato, quo in somnis certiora videamus, praeparatos quodam cultu atque victu proficisci ad dormiendum jubent: faba quidem Pythagorei utique abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo die venies, utique cum tuis apud me sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tibi mando ... ut pugnes, ne intercaletur: annum quidem utique teneto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad nostram consuetudinem sunt levia ... at in Graeciā, utique olim, magnae laudi erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 3</bibl>: saevire inde utique consulum <pb n="1947" /> <cb n="UTOR" /> alter patresque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ipsi quidem inviolati erant, utique postremis mensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 65, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 48, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen, de quo ambigitur, utique in aliā re certum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 102:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 102, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 8</bibl>: sciendum est, non omnes hac severitate tractari debere, sed utique humiliores, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merely</hi>, = duntaxat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50000.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With negatives (freq. only in post-Aug. writers, esp. in Quint.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not in Cic.): concurrunt ad eum legati, monentes, ne utique experiri vellet imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>by no means</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 59, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut iterum periremus ... nec ad perniciem nostram Carthaginensi utique aut duce aut exercitu opus esse,</quote> <trans><tr>not even</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 39, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 8, 10, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 16, 16: utique numquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 19, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapienti propositum est in vitā agendā, non utique, quod tentat, efficere, sed omnino recte facere: gubernatori propositum est, utique navem in portum perducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ut honestior causa, ita non utique prior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non utique accedit parti, quod universum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cogitatio non utique melior sit ea, sed tutior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ignoro igitur quos transeo, nec utique damno, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque utique cor ejus vulneratum esse, qui perit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uto: <entryFree id="n50001" type="main" key="u_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n50001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form of utor, q. v. </sense><sense id="n50001.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> form only <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> utito, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make use of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem in omnes quadrupedes utito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 96, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">utito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 107, 2</bibl></cit>; 123; 126; and, VTVNTO, C. I. L. 204, 1, 8.—</sense><sense id="n50001.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: quia supellex multa, quae non utitur, emitur, Nov. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utetur veris usibus hasta rudis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 45</bibl></cit>.—For the <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> v. utor.</sense></entryFree>
utor: <entryFree id="n50002" type="main" key="u_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtor</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">oetor</orth>, <itype>oesus</itype>, etc., from oitor, oisus, Lex. Thor. lin. 11; <sense id="n50002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> parag. oetier, Rogat. Tribun. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=246" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 246</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4</bibl>), ūsus (<hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> utier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 13</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n50002.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to use.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50002.2" n="A" level="2"> With <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n50002.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make use of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>: cave ... ne tibi hoc scipione malum magnum dem. <hi rend="ital">Paeg.</hi> Jam utere eo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 36</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Oh Epidicumne ego conspicor? <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Certe oculis utere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc oculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola potest animi per se natura ... durare et sensibus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus ipsis utere tuo judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam, quem ad modum oratione sum usurus alienā, sic mihi ore uti liceret alieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utor neque perantiquis neque inhumanis ac feris testibus,</quote> <trans><tr>cite</tr>, <tr>appeal to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim accusatore muto neque teste quisquam utitur eo, qui de accusatoris subsellio surgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num argumentis utendum in re ejus modi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:6:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipium, quo et omnes utimur, et non praebetur a populo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">9: quo interprete non ad linguam Graecam, sed ad furta et flagitia uti solebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 37</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">84: ut postea numquam dextro (oculo) aeque bene usus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si licet exemplis in parvo grandibus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus utendum est, quas fecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 347</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: ad eam rem usus est tuā mihi operā <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Utere, ut vis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum (navium) materiā atque aere ad reliquas reficiendas utebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administris ad ea sacrificia Druidibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eā potestate ad quaestum uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quam rem (deus) motu mentis ac ratione utatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 104</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utuntur aut aere aut taleis ferreis ad certum pondus examinatis pro nummo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n50002.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene ut armis, optime ut equis uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est quin eo ipso (equo), quo consuevit, libentius utatur quam intractato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim cum illā videas ut sit qui utamur (sc. pecunia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantis vectigalibus ad liberalitatem utens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum horis nostris nos essemus usi,</quote> <trans><tr>spent</tr>, <tr>exhausted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11, § 30</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">notum et quaerere et uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.7" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To wear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellibus aut parvis renonum tegimentis utuntur, magnā corporis parte nudā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne insignibus quidem regiis Tullus nisi jussu populi est ausus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.8" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To accept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adopt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā condicione, quae a Caesare ferretur, se usuros ostendebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
