G. 4</bibl></cit>, <cb n="UTOR" /> 11: <cit><quote lang="la">praeposteris enim utimur consiliis et acta agimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.9" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To resort to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Vectium ad se arcessit, quaestorem suum, cujus consilio uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.10" n="f" level="4"> Of a form or style of speech, sentiment, etc., <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adopt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonibus morologis utier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si provincia loqui posset, hac voce uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:in Caecin. 5:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecin. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac unā defensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:4:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec oratio, quā me uti res publica coëgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hortatione non egeas, non utar eā pluribus verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa criminatio, quā in me absentem usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.11" n="g" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practise</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">crucior, patrem ... nunc inprobi viri officio uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem nos disciplinā utimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero habere virtutem satis est quasi artem aliquam, nisi utare: etsi ars quidem, cum eā non utare, scientiā ipsā teneri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturni silentii, quo eram his temporibus usus, finem hodiernus dies attulit,</quote> <trans><tr>observed</tr>, <tr>kept</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos (senes) ego fortasse nunc imitor et utor aetatis vitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratione utuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>exercise moderation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut anteponantur ... ratione utentia rationis expertibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu, leno, postules Te hic fide lenoniā uti: non potis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus uteris per clivos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">adverb. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc utimur maxime more moro multum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita aperte ipsam rem locutus nil circuitione usus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.12" n="h" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take advantage of</hi>, etc.: otio qui nescit uti plus negoti habet, quam, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:20:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 20, 12</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 252 Vahl.): sinite ... eodem ut jure uti senem Liceat, quo jure sum usus adulescentior, i. e. <hi rend="ital">enjoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">commodius esse opinor duplici spe utier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Phorm. 4:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serius a terrā provectae naves neque usae nocturnā aurā in redeundo offenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda quibus utimur lucemque quā fruimur ab eo nobis dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maximo meo dolore hoc solacio utor, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 26 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: usus est hoc cupidine, tamdiu, dum, etc., <hi rend="ital">had the use of</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">borrowed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 6</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">I. B. 2. infra: utatur suis bonis oportet et fruatur, qui beatus futurus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter nauticarum rerum scientiam plurimisque maritimis rebus fruimur atque utimur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fortunā permittitis uti,</quote> <trans><tr>to try</tr>, <tr>take advantage of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrā utere amicitiā, ut voles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decet hunc ordinem ... bene utier amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertate modice utantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum Muneribus sapienter uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ofellam Integris opibus novi non latius usum Quam nunc accisis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia parvo nesciet uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus sapienter utens,</quote> <trans><tr>taking advantage of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: foro uti, <hi rend="ital">to make one's market</hi>, i. e. accommodate one's prices, actions, etc., to circumstances, take advantage of events: <cit><quote lang="la">scisti uti foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opportunae sunt divitiae ut utare (sc. eis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">adverb. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Silius quidem quicquam utitur (sc. suis hortis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 22, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50002.13" n="k" level="4"> Of passions, traits of character, etc., <hi rend="ital">to indulge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield to</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nos amore utemur semper subrepticio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alacritate ac studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitas, quā tu in iis rebus usus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus est ipse incredibili patientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: ego pervicaciam (esse hanc) aio, et eā me uti volo, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 433, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 5 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">dementer amoribus usa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 259</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut suā clementiā ac mansuetudine in eos utatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy</hi>, etc., ne simili utamur fortunā atque usi sumus, Quom, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc honore usi togati solent esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines amplissimis usos honoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiles amplis honoribus usi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem curuli honore usum praeterierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus externorum usus illo honore quem majores Latio quoque negaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 136</bibl></cit>: quoniam semel est odio civiliter<cb n="UTPO" />  usus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.15" n="m" level="4"> To use as food or medicine, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drink</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacte mero veteres usi memorantur et herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:369" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquis frigidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antidoto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 171" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino modice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex altero (loco, i. e. ex lacu) ut pecus uti possit (sc. aquā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.16" n="B" level="2"> With the thing used, etc., as direct obj. (class. only in <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi> constr.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): nuptias abjeci, amicos utor primoris viros, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 497, 15</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 164 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">facilitatem vulgariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:ib. 481:21" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> ib. 481, 21</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 98 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">res pulchras, quas uti solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:ib. 500:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 500, 16</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 69 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita uti eum oportet libertatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> ib. 481, 19</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 98 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">cetera quae volumus uti Graecā mercamur fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic mihi, an boni quid usquam'st, quod quisquam uti possiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diutine uti bene licet partum bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto uteris ut voles operam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea, quae praeter spem evenere, utantur sine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">BALINEVM ... QVOD VSI FVERANT AMPLIVS ANNIS XXXX.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 202</bibl></cit>: si quid est, quod utar, utor: si non est, egeo, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:23:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam albam, quam voles uti, condito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:R. R. 118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam rem etiam nomine eodem medici utuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 17:4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 17, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.17" n="2" level="3"> Hence, esp. <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi> in phrases dare utendum, <hi rend="ital">to lend;</hi> recipere or rogare or petere utendum, <hi rend="ital">to borrow</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in Plaut.): quod datum utendum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae utenda vasa semper vicini rogant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:47 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 47 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 10</bibl>: auris tibi contra utendas dabo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 506, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 364 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae bona is Heraclio omnia utenda ac possidenda tradiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te, quod utendum acceperis, reddidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa rogant utenda dari, data reddere nolunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 433</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.18" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (through the intermediate idea of having and using). </sense><sense id="n50002.19" n="A" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to enjoy the friendship of</hi> any one; <hi rend="ital">to be familiar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intimate with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to associate with</hi> a person. </sense><sense id="n50002.20" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">abl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his Fabriciis semper est usus Oppianicus familiarissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (Caeciliā) pater usus erat plurimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebonio multos annos utor valde familiariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucceius qui multum utitur Bruto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utere Pompeio Grospho,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto deceat majoribus uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sciret regibus uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> ib. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me verebatur ut me formatore morum, me quasi magistro uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.21" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilica vicinas aliasque mulieres quam minimum utatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50002.22" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be in possession of</hi> a thing, esp. <hi rend="ital">to have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">find</hi> a thing in some particular mode or character; with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi si unquam filius erit, ne ille facili me utetur patre,</quote> <trans><tr>he shall find an indulgent father in me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">patre usus est diligente et diti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis justisque regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sc. libertas) non in eo est, ut justo utamur domino, sed ut nullo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vide quam me sis usurus aequo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 59, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is illis benignis usus est ad commodandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">6: ne bestiis quoque immanioribus uteremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me Capitolinus convictore usus amicoque A puero est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uteris monitoribus isdem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudine non bonā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (sc. Philoctete) successore sagittae Herculis utuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 52</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam pol placidum te et clementem eo usque modo ut volui usus sum in alto (= placidum te esse ut volui, sic te usus sum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">possessing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that possesses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utentior sane sit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a larger possessor</tr>, <tr>richer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utpote: <entryFree id="n50003" type="main" key="utpo^te^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ut-pŏtĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n50003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as namely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">namely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as being</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeing that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inasmuch as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since</hi> (rare but class.; cf. quippe); introducing an explanation. </sense><sense id="n50003.1" n="1" level="3"> Usually with a <hi rend="ital">pron. rel.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis nequam sum, utpote qui hodie inceperim amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea nos, utpote qui nihil contemnere soleamus, non pertimescebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 4</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. solemus): Lucius quidem frater <pb n="1948" /> <cb n="UTRI" /> ejus, utpote qui peregre depugnarit, familiam ducit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">similiorem mulierem Magisque eandem, utpote quae non sit eadem, non reor Deos facere posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amo hercle, opinor, utpote quod pro certo sciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utpote quae mi Speraret nec linguam esse nec auriculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50003.2" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: nec retinuissem (legiones), si uno loco habuissem, utpote cum singulae quaedam cohortes seditionem fecerint, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommoda valetudo, quā jam emerseram, utpote cum sine febri laborassem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50003.3" n="3" level="3"> With participles: <cit><quote lang="la">inde Rubos fessi pervenimus, utpote longum Carpentes iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerulo me, utpote non amplius novem annos nato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50003.4" n="4" level="3"> In adjectival phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">quin id erat curae, quo pacto cuncta tenerem, Utpote res tenues, tenui sermone peractas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sunt quos genus hoc minime juvat, utpote plures Culpari dignos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo sane populus numerabilis, utpote parvus Et frugi castusque verecundusque coibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utputa: <entryFree id="n50004" type="main" key="utpu^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">utpŭta</orth>, v. puto.</entryFree>
utralibet: <entryFree id="n50005" type="main" key="u_^tra_li^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trālĭbet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. uterlibet <sense id="n50005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
utrarius: <entryFree id="n50006" type="hapax" key="u_tra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. uter</etym>, in milit. lang., <sense id="n50006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who brings water in skins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a water-carrier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi se utrarios ad mare jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utrasque: <entryFree id="n50007" type="main" key="u_^trasque^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trasquĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. uterque <sense id="n50007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
utribi: <entryFree id="n50008" type="main" key="u_^tri^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trĭbi</orth>, v. utrubi.</entryFree>
utricida: <entryFree id="n50009" type="hapax" key="u_tri^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtrĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. uter-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n50009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who cuts skins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bags in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a skin-slayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utricide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non homicidam sed utricidam amplecterer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 13, p. 137, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utricularius: <entryFree id="n50010" type="main" key="u_tri^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtrĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. utriculus</etym>. <sense id="n50010.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bagpiper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4119 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50010.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The master of a raft floated on bladders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used for ferriage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 431, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">428, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">547, 8</bibl>; Inscr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> p. 470, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
utriculus: <entryFree id="n50011" type="main" key="u_tri^cu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūtrĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. uter</etym>, <sense id="n50011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leathern bottle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50012" type="main" key="u_^tri^cu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>uterus</etym>. <sense id="n50012.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abdomen</hi>, of bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50012.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a little womb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">matrix</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:124" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 14, 43, § 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50012.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">a bud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calycle</hi> of a flower, <hi rend="ital">a hull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">husk</hi> of grain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 39, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:115" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 11, 29, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
utrimque: <entryFree id="n50013" type="main" key="u_^trimque^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trimquĕ</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ū^trinquĕ</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>uterque</etym>, <sense id="n50013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the one side and on the other.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50013.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: horrescit telis exercitus asper utrimque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 385 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tollitur in caelum clamor exortus utrimque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 500 (Ann. v. 422 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">clamor utrinque, undique concursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam utrimque exitum est maxumā copiā, Dispertiti viri ... tubae utrimque canunt: contra Consonat terra: clamorem utrimque efferunt, Imperator utrimque hinc et illinc Jovi vota suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:65 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 65 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae utrimque copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acriter utrimque usque ad vesperum pugnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis utrimque interfectis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteros utrimque aggreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni utrimque praemissi equites rem exploravissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 53, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna binis utrinque fibulis distinebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>one on each side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continebitur marginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinentium manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: praecisa vipera, <hi rend="ital">at both ends</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">head and tail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50013.2" n="B" level="2"> Connected with <hi rend="ital">secus</hi> (sometimes written in one word, utrimquesecus), <hi rend="ital">along</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on either hand</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quare utrimque secus cum corpus vapulet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:939" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 939</bibl></cit> (936): <cit><quote lang="la">canes utrimque secus deae latera muniunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 464</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, § 719</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50013.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Alcumena) Utrimque est gravida et ex viro et ex summo Jove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrimque constitit fides,</quote> <trans><tr>both parties kept their word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piso M. Crasso et Scriboniā genitus nobilis utrimque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 66, § 163</bibl> (al. utrique); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est medium vitiorum et utrimque reductum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia sunt non necessaria, vel utrimque vel ab alterā parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:1" default="NO">5, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas veras modo et utrimque tractet, i. e. pro et contra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utrimquesecus: <entryFree id="n50014" type="main" key="u_^trimque^se^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trimquĕsĕcus</orth>, v. utrimque, I. B. <cb n="UTRU" /></entryFree>
utrinde: <entryFree id="n50015" type="main" key="u_^trinde^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trindĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>uter-inde</etym>, <sense id="n50015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi>: de frumento utrobi bona, utrobi mala gratia capiatur, utrinde iram, utrinde factiones tibi pares, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 198</bibl> P.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrinde orarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utrinsecus: <entryFree id="n50016" type="hapax" key="u_^trinse^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trin-sĕcus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>uter-secus</etym>, <sense id="n50016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolumi fervore cadunt utrinsecus ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 503</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utro: <entryFree id="n50017" type="main" key="u_^tro_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 3. uter <sense id="n50017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
utrobi: <entryFree id="n50018" type="main" key="u_^tro^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trŏbi</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. utrubi.</entryFree>
utrobidem: <entryFree id="n50019" type="main" key="u_^tro^bi_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trŏbīdem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. utrubidem.</entryFree>
utrobique: <entryFree id="n50020" type="main" key="u_^tro^bi_que^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trŏbīquĕ</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ū^trŭbīquĕ</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>utrubi-que</etym>, <sense id="n50020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on both parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the one side and the other</hi> (rare but class.): quia utrobique magnos inimicos habebam, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrobique autem conventicium accipiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">depopulatus Hypatensem primo, deinde Heracleensem agrum, inutili utrobique auxilio Aetolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eodem tempore utrobique respublica prospere gereretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrobique Eumenes plus valebat,</quote> <trans><tr>with land and naval forces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur ut eadem veritas utrobique sit eademque lex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with gods and with men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:31:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 31, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assunt multa ejus rei exempla tam laesae hercle quam conservatae sanctissime utrobique opinionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:27" default="NO">3, 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:91" default="NO">4, 2, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui timet his adversa, fere miratur eodem, Quo cupiens, pacto: pavor est utrobique molestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
utrolibet: <entryFree id="n50021" type="main" key="u_^tro_li^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trōlĭbet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. uterlibet <sense id="n50021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
utroque: <entryFree id="n50022" type="main" key="u_^tro_que^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trōquĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. uterque <sense id="n50022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
utroqueversum: <entryFree id="n50023" type="main" key="u_^tro_que^versum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trōquĕversum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. uterque <sense id="n50023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
utrubi: <entryFree id="n50024" type="main" key="u_^tru^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trŭbi</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trŏbi</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trĭbi</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>uter-ubi</etym>, <sense id="n50024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at which of two places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which of the two sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where</hi> (when two are spoken of; ante- and post-class.): utrubi cenaturi estis? hiccine an in triclinio? Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 198</bibl> P.: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Utrubi accumbo? <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Utrubi tu vis. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Cum ambobus volo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 14</bibl>: de frumento utrobi bona, utrobi mala gratia capiatur, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 198</bibl> P.: utrubi hic homo fuit, Edict. Praet. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 31</bibl> pr. (De utrubi); cf. Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, § 148 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, § 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
utrubidem: <entryFree id="n50025" type="hapax" key="u_^tru^bi_dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trŭbīdem</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ū^trŏbīdem</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>utrubi-dem</etym>, <sense id="n50025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on both sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on each</hi> or <hi rend="ital">either side</hi> (when the two sides are spoken of): <cit><quote lang="la">utrosque percognovi utrubidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit> (dub.; Speng. utrosque pergnovi probe).</sense></entryFree>
utrubique: <entryFree id="n50026" type="main" key="u_^tru^bi_que^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trŭbīquĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. utrobique.</entryFree>
utrum: <entryFree id="n50027" type="main" key="u_^trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ū^trum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>uter</etym>. <sense id="n50027.0" n="I" level="1"> Introducing an alternative question (direct or indirect), with <hi rend="ital">an</hi> beginning the second clause (v. an); in Engl. represented in direct questions simply by the tone of voice, and in indirect questions by <hi rend="ital">whether.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50027.1" n="A" level="2"> In a direct interrogation. </sense><sense id="n50027.2" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, </sense><sense id="n50027.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Attached to the emphatic word of the first clause: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum tu masne an femina es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Simulato me amare. <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> Utrum ego istoc jocon' assimulem, an serio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum studione id sibi habet an laudi putat Fore?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum igitur tandem perspicuisne dubia aperiuntur an dubiis perspicua tolluntur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum censes illum tuamne de se orationem libentius auditurum fuisse an meam?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> attached to utrum, utrumne ... an (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): utrumne jussi persequemur otium ... An hunc laborem, etc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumne salvum eum nolet orator, an? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumne igitur ego sum, Domiti, exemplo gravis an tu, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> repeated in place of <hi rend="ital">an</hi> (very rare): sed utrum terraene motus, sonitusne inferum Pervasit auris? Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 6, p. 680</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. v. 479 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n50027.6" n="2" level="3"> Without <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, utrum ... an (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">utrum pro ancillā me habes, an pro filiā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum hac me feriam, an ab laevā, latus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed utrum nunc tu coelibem ted esse mavis liberum, an maritum servom, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum pro dimidiā parte, an pro totā societate? Utrum pro me an pro me et pro te?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum ea vestra an nostra culpa est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.7" n="B" level="2"> In an indirect interrogation. </sense><sense id="n50027.8" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> attached, </sense><sense id="n50027.9" n="(a)" level="5"> To the emphatic word of the first clause: sed <cb n="UTRU" /> utrum strictimne attonsurum dicam esse an per pectinem Nescio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum'st primum utrum eae velintne an non velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animo depugnat suo, Utrum itane esse ma. velit ... an ita potius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 1</bibl>: de istac rogas Virgine? <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> Ita, utrum praedicemne an taceam? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res nunc in discrimine versatur, utrum possitne se parsimonia defendere, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videamus, utrum ea fortuitane sint an eo statu, quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 34, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est ... illa distinctio, utrum ... an ... et utrum illudne ... an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:27:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 27, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> attached to utrum; utrumne ... an (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec quidquam differre utrumne in pulvere ... ludas opus, an meretricis amore Sollicitus plores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumne Divitiis homines an sint virtute beati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo plures dissenserunt, utrumne hae partes essent rhetorices, an ejusdem opera, an elementa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dareus dubitaverat utrumne circa Mesopotamiam subsisteret, an interiora regna sui peteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:50" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> attached to <hi rend="ital">an;</hi> utrum ... anne: <cit><quote lang="la">me jussit percontarier utrum aurum reddat anne eat secum simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quaerendumque utrum una species sit earum anne plures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:206" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id autem utrum illi sentiant anne simulent, tu intelleges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 51, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. uter, I. B. 4, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n50027.12" n="2" level="3"> Without <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu, malum, curas, Utrum crudum an coctum edim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facite indicium, utrum hac an illac iter institerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum stultitiā facere ego hunc an malitiā Dicam, incertus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id utrum Romano more locutus sit, an, quomodo Stoici dicunt, postea videro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permultum interest, utrum perturbatione aliquā animi, an consulto fiat injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid interest utrum hoc feceris, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:75:section=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 75, § 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum interest, utrum laus imminuatur, an salus deseratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: quomodo transierit, utrum rate an piscatorio navigio, nemo sciebat, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.13" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">necne</hi> (rarely <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>) in place of the second clause with <hi rend="ital">an;</hi> utrum ... necne, <hi rend="ital">whether</hi> ... <hi rend="ital">or not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum ego erro, qui quaeram, utrum emeris necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:16:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 16, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di utrum sint necne sint quaeritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum proelium committi ex usu esset necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: deliberent, utrum traiciant legiones necne ... et Brutum arcessant necne, et mihi stipendium dent an decernant, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 48, 2</bibl>.—So, utrum ... ne: <cit><quote lang="la">cum interrogaretur, utrum pluris patrem matremne faceret? matrem inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphic. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.14" n="II" level="1"> Introducing a disjunctive question with more than two members, with <hi rend="ital">an</hi> beginning each clause after the first. </sense><sense id="n50027.15" n="A" level="2"> A direct question: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum hoc tu parum commeministi, an ego non satis intellexi, an mutasti sententiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum hoc signum cupiditatis tuae an tropaeum necessitudinis an amoris indicium esse voluisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 36, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum hostem an vos an fortunam utriusque populi ignoratis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum major ... an majores ... an aetas ... an cum Karthaginiensi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 43, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.16" n="B" level="2"> An indirect question: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (convivio) nemo potest dicere utrum ille plus biberit an vomuerit an effuderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum admonitus an temptatus an sine duce ullo ... nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.17" n="III" level="1"> Introducing a single question without an expressed alternative (cf. the similar use of an). </sense><sense id="n50027.18" n="a" level="4"> In a direct interrogation: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum enim in clarissimis est civibus is, quem judicatum hic duxit Hermippus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum igitur hactenus satis est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum majores vestri omnium magnarum rerum et principia exorti ab diis sunt et finem eum statuerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50027.19" n="b" level="4"> In an indirect interrogation: <cit><quote lang="la">neque utrum ex hoc saltu damni salvum scio eliciam foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an hoc dicere audebis, utrum de te aratores, utrum denique Siculi universi bene existiment, ad rem id non pertinere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 167</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1949" /> <cb n="UXOR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 6, 1</bibl>.—With the interrog. particle <hi rend="ital">nam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum percontatus esset, utrumnam Patris universa classis in portu stare posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 17, 10</bibl></cit> dub. Weissenb. ad loc. (Hertz and Madv. possetne).</sense></entryFree>
utut: <entryFree id="n50028" type="main" key="u^tut"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ŭtut</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ut, I. A. 3.</entryFree>
uva: <entryFree id="n50029" type="main" key="u_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. for ug-va, root ug-, to be moist; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(gro/s</foreign>; Lat. uvere; cf.: umor, uvidus, etc.; so Corss.; Curt. refers it to root ug-; Sanscr. ugras, strong; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(gih/s</foreign>, healthful</etym>. <sense id="n50029.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50029.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the vine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a grape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quā (gemmā) oriens uva se ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella adservanda nigerrimis diligentius uvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17</bibl></cit>. 16: <cit><quote lang="la">quo Duceret apricis in collibus uva colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic segetes, illic veniunt felicius uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa videntur prodigialiter accidisse, ut aliqua vitis excederet uvarum numerum MM.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra feracior uvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva ejus indecora visu, sapore jucunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Feb. 29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva non alibi gratior callo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50029.2" n="B" level="2"> Collect., <hi rend="ital">grapes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressantes inquinet uva pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 18; <cit><quote lang="la">4 (5), 2, 13: pressos pedibus dedit uva liquores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 31</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50029.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50029.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bunch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cluster of grapes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvis, quae magnitudinem infantium puerorum exsuperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemellarum, quibus hoc nomen uvae semper geminae dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 4, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50029.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert uva racemos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50029.6" n="C" level="2"> Of other plants, <hi rend="ital">a bunch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cluster of fruit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amomi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 13, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 29, 52, § 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50029.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cluster</hi>, like a bunch of grapes, which bees form when they alight in swarming, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 558</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 18, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:68" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 68</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50029.8" n="E" level="2"> The soft palate, <hi rend="ital">the uvula</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ki/wn</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:157" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 80, § 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 4, 11, § 31</bibl>; 34, 12, 29, § 118; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:56:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 56, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50029.9" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 2, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:138" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 49, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uvens: <entryFree id="n50030" type="main" key="u_vens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūvens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [uveo, whence uvesco, uvidus, etc.], <sense id="n50030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humid</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:651" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:469" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:144" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 144</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uvesco: <entryFree id="n50031" type="main" key="u_vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūvesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n50031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [uveo, uvens], <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dank</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">humid</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n50031.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensae in litore vestes Uvescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 306</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 254</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50031.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refresh one's self</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to drink freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tipple</hi>: seu quis capit acria fortis Pocula, seu modicis uvescit laetius, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uviditas: <entryFree id="n50032" type="main" key="u_vi^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūvĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moisture</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Signif. Diaet. Pass. 68" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Signif. Diaet. Pass. 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uvidulus: <entryFree id="n50033" type="hapax" key="u_vi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūvĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [uvidus], <hi rend="ital">moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvidulam a fletu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uvidus: <entryFree id="n50034" type="main" key="u_vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uveo, uvens; v. uva <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n50034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50034.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: umidus, madidus): rete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: (mulieres) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:238" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvidus ventosusque status caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Menalcas,</quote> <trans><tr>wet with the dew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiburis ripae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>well-watered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rura assiduis aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:686" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>juicy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50034.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50034.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Drunken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicimus integro Sicci mane die, dicimus uvidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50034.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Vapid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uvifer: <entryFree id="n50035" type="main" key="u_vi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūvĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uva-fero</etym>, <sense id="n50035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clusterbearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">producing grapes</hi> (in post-Aug. poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">Massicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:263" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
uvor: <entryFree id="n50036" type="main" key="u_vor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ūvor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>uveo, uvens; v. uva <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n50036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moistness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humidity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae ab uvore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 104</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
uxama: <entryFree id="n50037" type="main" key="Uxa^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Uxăma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:384" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 384</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uxellodunum: <entryFree id="n50038" type="main" key="Uxello^du_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Uxellŏdūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Aquitaine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Cadurci</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capdenac</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:32" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:40:1" default="NO">40, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uxor: <entryFree id="n50039" type="main" key="uxor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uxor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype> (for the form VXSOR in inscrr. <sense id="n50039.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">X</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. vaca, wife</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a wife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consort</hi> (syn. conjux). </sense><sense id="n50039.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">licuit uxorem dotatam ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 86</bibl></cit>: duxit me uxorem <cb n="V" /> liberorum sibi quaesendūm gratia, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. quaeso, p. 258 (Trag. v. 161 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">so very freq. ducere uxorem, v. duco: uxorem adjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicule illud L. Nasica censori Catoni, cum ille Ex tui animi sententiā tu uxorem habes? Non hercle, inquit, ex animi mei sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erus, quantum audio, uxore excidit,</quote> <trans><tr>must go without a wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tu dicis, mea uxor, non te mihi irasci decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—On the legal condition of Roman married women, v. Rein, Röm. Privatr. p. 182 sq.; Dict. of Antiq. s. v. uxor.—</sense><sense id="n50039.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50039.3" n="A" level="2"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">olentis uxores mariti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>she-goats</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50039.4" n="B" level="2"> Humorously, of <hi rend="ital">the cloak</hi> (abolla) as inseparable from the poor man, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:53:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 53, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uxorcula: <entryFree id="n50040" type="main" key="uxorcu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uxorcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>uxor</etym>, <sense id="n50040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wife</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei uxorcula satis quidem tenuis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 219, 8</bibl></cit>.—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">mea uxorcula!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 38</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 83, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
uxorius: <entryFree id="n50041" type="main" key="uxo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">uxōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a wife</hi> or <hi rend="ital">married woman.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50041.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50041.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arbitrio rei uxoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 17, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abhorrens ab re uxoriā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>averse to marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam formam modicam et modestam Favorinus non inscite appellabat uxoriam,</quote> <trans><tr>appropriate for a wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:11:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 11, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tears for the death of a wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:31" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 29</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">levamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50041.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">uxōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tax laid on old-bachelors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the old-bachelor tax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n50041.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">excessively fond of one's wife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uxorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcramque uxorius urbem Exstruis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis (Tiberis), as the husband of Ilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: Vulcanus, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 59: juvenis, Auct. Paneg. ad Maxim. et Constantin. 4.</sense></entryFree>
uzita: <entryFree id="n50042" type="main" key="Uzi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Uzīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Byzacene in</hi> Africa Propria, Auct. B. Afr. 41; 51; 56; 58. <cb n="V." /></sense></entryFree>
v: <entryFree id="n50043" type="main" key="V"><orth extent="full" lang="la">V</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">v</orth>, a character derived from the Greek <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>, Mar. Victor. p. 2459 P. A consonant which, though originally written with the same sign as the vowel <sense id="n50043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">u</hi> (v. the letter U), was by the ancients themselves considered as essentially different from it, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 57</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 416</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">420</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 539</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">542</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">544</bibl> sq. P.; Vel. Long. p. 2215; 2222 P.; just as the consonant <hi rend="ital">i</hi> (<hi rend="ital">j</hi>) and the vowel <hi rend="ital">i</hi> were regarded as two distinct letters; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">J</ref></xr>. </sense><sense id="n50043.1" n="I" level="1"> The sound of V seems to have been the same with that of English initial W. It corresponded to the Æolic digamma; <cit><quote lang="la">hence it is called,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 29</bibl></cit>, Aeolica littera, and the emperor Claudius used the Greek digamma inverted F <figure /> to represent it (because in its proper position it already formed the Latin letter F), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 545 sq.</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 5, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also the inscrr. of the period during and immediately succeeding the reign of Claudius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 710 sq.</bibl></cit>; Marini Atti, p. 97.
